translated: It is difficult for all worldly beings, hearers, and solitary buddhas to know.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa gang gis sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa kun 'dzin pa'i dran pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mngon sum mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa gang gis sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa kun 'dzin pa'i dran pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mngon sum mo //
translated: The mindfulness of the bodhisattva by which he retains all that the Buddhas have taught is the direct experience of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa de ni 'di 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa de ni 'di 'dra'o //
translated: Such is the mindfulness of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa de'i gnas ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa de'i gnas ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The basis of that mindfulness of the bodhisattva is tenfold:

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
translated: the application of mindfulness to the body, the application of mindfulness to feeling, the application of mindfulness to thought, the application of mindfulness to the factors of existence, the application of mindfulness to the Buddha,

original: chos rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
translated: the close placement of mindfulness that is recollection of generosity,

original: lha rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: lha rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: and the close placement of mindfulness that is recollection of the deities.

original: 'di dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten close placements of mindfulness.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ close placement of mindfulness of the body?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar lus 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' nas ma 'ongs /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar lus 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' nas ma 'ongs /
translated: Here a bodhisattva considers, ‘This body does not come from the past and does not go into the future.

original: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'gro /🔽sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i @71a *//
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'gro / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i @71a *//
translated: It does not remain in the present.🔽It does not abide in the past,

original: mtha' la mi gnas te /
analyzed: mtha' la mi gnas te /
translated: the future, or the present.

original: gzhan du na yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not real,

original: phyin ci log las byung ba /
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung ba /
translated: but arises from error.

original: byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa /
analyzed: byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa /
translated: It has no agent and no experiencer.

original: thog ma dang / tha ma dang / dbus med pa; rtsa ba gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: thog ma dang / tha ma dang / dbus med pa; rtsa ba gnas pa med pa /
translated: It has no beginning, no end, and no middle.

original: bdag po med pa /
analyzed: bdag po med pa /
translated: It has no root, no owner,

original: nga yi ba med pa /
analyzed: nga yi ba med pa /
translated: no “mine,”

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ste /
translated: and no grasping.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba dang / lus zhes bya ba dang / longs spyod ces bya ba dang / gnas zhes bya ba dang / ro zhes bya ba dang / skye mched ces bya ba ni glo bur gyi tha snyad rnams kyis tha snyad tu btags pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba dang / lus zhes bya ba dang / longs spyod ces bya ba dang / gnas zhes bya ba dang / ro zhes bya ba dang / skye mched ces bya ba ni glo bur gyi tha snyad rnams kyis tha snyad tu btags pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, the body, enjoyments, abodes, tastes, and sense bases are all designated by conventional terms.

original: lus 'di ni snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni snying po med pa ste /
translated: This body is without essence.

original: pha ma'i khu ba dang / khrag las byung ba /
analyzed: pha ma'i khu ba dang / khrag las byung ba /
translated: It comes from the semen and blood of one’s parents.

original: mi gtsang ba /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba /
translated: It is impure,

original: rul ba / rang bzhin gyis dri mi zhim pa /
analyzed: rul ba / rang bzhin gyis dri mi zhim pa /
translated: rotten, and naturally foul-smelling.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jigs pa dang / sgyid lugs pa'i rkun pos dkrugs pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jigs pa dang / sgyid lugs pa'i rkun pos dkrugs pa /
translated: It is disturbed by the thieves of desire, anger, ignorance, fear, and laziness.

original: rtag tu 'jig pa /🔽'brul pa / 'bral ba /
analyzed: rtag tu 'jig pa / 'brul pa / 'bral ba /
translated: It is always decaying,

original: rnam par 'thor ba /🔽rnam par 'joms pa'i chos can /
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba /🔽rnam par 'joms pa'i chos can /
translated: breaking apart, and separating.🔽It is scattered🔽and subject to destruction.

original: nad tha dad pa brgya stong gi tshang ngo snyam du lus la dran pa nye bar 'jog go /
analyzed: nad tha dad pa brgya stong gi tshang ngo snyam du lus la dran pa nye bar 'jog go /
translated: He places his mindfulness in the body, thinking, “This body is a nest of a hundred thousand different diseases.”

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar lus 'di ni rkang pa dang / rkang sor dang / byin pa dang / brla dang / gru do dang / lto ba dang / lte ba dang / sgal tshigs dang / snying dang / rtsi ba logs dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar lus 'di ni rkang pa dang / rkang sor dang / byin pa dang / brla dang / gru do dang / lto ba dang / lte ba dang / sgal tshigs dang / snying dang / rtsi ba logs dang /
translated: this body is merely a collection of feet, toes, calves, thighs, hips, belly, navel, spine, heart, ribs,

original: rtsib ma dang / lag pa'i thal mo dang / dpung ba dang / thal gong dang / mgrin pa dang / 'gram pa dang / dpral ba dang / mgo'i @71b thod pa 'dus pa tsam ste /
analyzed: rtsib ma dang / lag pa'i thal mo dang / dpung ba dang / thal gong dang / mgrin pa dang / 'gram pa dang / dpral ba dang / mgo'i @71b thod pa 'dus pa tsam ste /
translated: ribs, palms, arms, shoulders, neck, cheeks, forehead, and skull.

original: las 'byung ba'i byed pas bsags pa /
analyzed: las 'byung ba'i byed pas bsags pa /
translated: It is accumulated by the activity of karma,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa brgya stong gi gnas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa brgya stong gi gnas so //
translated: a dwelling place for a hundred thousand different afflictions, secondary afflictions, thoughts, and concepts.

original: 'di ni rdzas mang po 'dus pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rdzas mang po 'dus pa 'di lta ste /
translated: This is a collection of many substances,

original: skra dang / spu dang / se mo dang / so dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / lus dang / rgyus pa dang / tshil dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / mcher ba dang / gcin dang / phyi sa dang /
analyzed: skra dang / spu dang / se mo dang / so dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / lus dang / rgyus pa dang / tshil dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / mcher ba dang / gcin dang / phyi sa dang /
translated: hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, marrow, kidney, heart, liver, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, mucus, fluid in the cavities, urine, and the contents of the womb.

original: pho ba dang / long ka dang / khrag dang / ngar snabs dang / mkhris pa dang / rnag dang / mchil ma dang / klad pa dang / klad rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: pho ba dang / long ka dang / khrag dang / ngar snabs dang / mkhris pa dang / rnag dang / mchil ma dang / klad pa dang / klad rgyas rnams te /
translated: hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, marrow, kidney, heart, liver, lungs, small intestines, large intestines, stomach, spleen, excrement, brain, and meninges.

original: de de ltar rdzas mang po 'dus pa yin na /
analyzed: de de ltar rdzas mang po 'dus pa yin na /
translated: If this body is a collection of many substances,

original: de la lus zhes ji skad du bya snyam du lus la dran pa nye bar 'jog go /
analyzed: de la lus zhes ji skad du bya snyam du lus la dran pa nye bar 'jog go /
translated: what is this so-called body?’ In this way, he establishes the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: de la so sor rtog pa na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la so sor rtog pa na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When he examines it, he thinks,

original: lus 'di ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs so snyam nas de lus la nam mkha' ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog go /
analyzed: lus 'di ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs so snyam nas de lus la nam mkha' ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog go /
translated: ‘This body is like space.’ In this way, he establishes the application of mindfulness to the body as being like space.

original: de thams cad nam mkha' ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: de thams cad nam mkha' ltar mthong ngo //
translated: He sees everything as being like space.

original: de lus yongs su shes par bya ba las gang la'ang dran pa mi 'jug go /
analyzed: de lus yongs su shes par bya ba las gang la'ang dran pa mi 'jug go /
translated: He does not apply his mindfulness to anything in order to understand the body.

original: mi ldog go /
analyzed: mi ldog go /
translated: “It does not return.

original: mi 'jug mi ldog pas dran pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jug mi ldog pas dran pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it does not engage and does not return, it is called ‘abiding in mindfulness.’

original: de ltar dran pa la gnas pa ni 'di ltar lus ji lta ba byang chub kyang de bzhin du shes te /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa la gnas pa ni 'di ltar lus ji lta ba byang chub kyang de bzhin du shes te /
translated: “Thus, abiding in mindfulness, one knows that just as the body is, so is awakening.

original: 'di la thogs par bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'di la thogs par bya ba med do //
translated: There is nothing to be obstructed here.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; gang du thogs pa de thams cad ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; gang du thogs pa de thams cad ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste /
translated: Why is that? Because everything that is obstructed is not in accord with reality.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba dran pa nye @72a *//
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba dran pa nye @72a *//
translated: This is called the bodhisatvas’ application of mindfulness to the body.

original: bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisatvas’ application of mindfulness to experiences?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here the bodhisatvas think as follows:

original: tshor ba zhes bya ba ni khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya ba ni khong du chud pa ste /
translated: ‘Experiences are understood.

original: reg pa de'ang phyin ci log dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / de gnyi ga las rnam par grol ba'o snyam mo //
analyzed: reg pa de'ang phyin ci log dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / de gnyi ga las rnam par grol ba'o snyam mo //
translated: Contact is distorted, undistorted, and free from both. ’

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo sems g-yengs pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams kyi tshor ba ni phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo sems g-yengs pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams kyi tshor ba ni phyin ci log ste /
translated: The feeling of the childish ordinary person, whose mind is distracted and deluded, is deluded.

original: de dag ni mi rtag pa la rtag par tshor ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mi rtag pa la rtag par tshor ro //
translated: They feel permanence in impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar tshor ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar tshor ro //
translated: They feel pleasure in suffering.

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu tshor ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu tshor ro //
translated: They feel a self in selflessness.

original: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar tshor te /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar tshor te /
translated: They feel purity in impurity.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log gi tshor ba'o //🔽gang mi rtag pa la mi rtag par tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du tshor ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag med par tshor ba dang / mi gtsang ba la mi gtsang bar tshor ba 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log gi tshor ba'o // gang mi rtag pa la mi rtag par tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du tshor ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag med par tshor ba dang / mi gtsang ba la mi gtsang bar tshor ba 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi tshor ba'o //
translated: This is deluded feeling.🔽The feeling of the śrāvakas is to feel impermanence in impermanence, to feel suffering in suffering, to feel selflessness in selflessness, and to feel impurity in impurity.

original: gang mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa yang ma yin par tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa yang ma yin par tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: The feeling of the bodhisattvas is to feel impermanence in impermanence and also permanence, to feel suffering in suffering and also pleasure, to feel selflessness in selflessness and also self, and to feel impurity in impurity and also purity.

original: bde ba'ang ma yin par tshor ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag med pa dang / bdag med pa'ang ma yin par tshor ba dang / mi gtsang ba la mi gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba'ang ma yin par tshor ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin par tshor ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag med pa dang / bdag med pa'ang ma yin par tshor ba dang / mi gtsang ba la mi gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba'ang ma yin par tshor ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshor ba'o //
translated: They feel that which is not pleasant as not pleasant, and that which is neither as neither. They feel that which is not a self as not a self, and that which is neither as neither. They feel that which is impure as impure, and that which is neither as neither.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshor ba ni tshor ba po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshor ba ni tshor ba po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: “ Bodhisattvas, feeling thus, do not see a feeler.

original: de mi mthong bas tshor ba'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de mi mthong bas tshor ba'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Not seeing that, they do not see feeling.

original: de @72b 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de @72b 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dus byas thams cad ni tshor ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dus byas thams cad ni tshor ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said, ‘All that is conditioned is suffering. ’

original: gal te 'dus byas thams cad tshor ba ma yin na ni 'di la tshor ba po zhes bya ba ci zhig yod /🔽tshor ba ni tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas thams cad tshor ba ma yin na ni 'di la tshor ba po zhes bya ba ci zhig yod / tshor ba ni tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: If all that is conditioned were not suffering, what would the Tathāgata have taught as suffering?🔽Feeling is not a feeler.

original: tshor bar bya ba dang / tshor ba dang / tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: tshor bar bya ba dang / tshor ba dang / tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: It is not a feeling, nor is it a feeler.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus byas tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus byas tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: Unconditioned phenomena do not cause conditioned phenomena to be felt.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas las rnam par grol ba'i tshor bar byed pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas las rnam par grol ba'i tshor bar byed pa gang yang med de /
translated: There is no feeling that is free from conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de ltar tshor ba de dag tshor ba med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba de dag tshor ba med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, he sees that all feelings are beyond feeling.

original: 'di la tshor bas rtsol ba gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di la tshor bas rtsol ba gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see any effort in feeling.

original: byang chub ji lta ba tshor ba'ang de bzhin du yang dag par rjes su mthong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta ba tshor ba'ang de bzhin du yang dag par rjes su mthong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He sees that feeling is just like awakening. This is called the bodhisatvas’ close application of mindfulness of feeling.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisatvas’ close application of mindfulness of mind?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here the bodhisatvas think as follows:

original: gang tshor ba de ni sems tsam mo //
analyzed: gang tshor ba de ni sems tsam mo //
translated: ‘That which feels is just the mind.

original: sems de'ang gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: sems de'ang gnas pa med pa /
translated: The mind is without a basis.

original: gzung ba med pa /
analyzed: gzung ba med pa /
translated: It is ungraspable.

original: lus med pa'o //🔽gang gnas med pa /
analyzed: lus med pa'o // gang gnas med pa /
translated: It is without a body.🔽It is without a basis.

original: gzung ba med pa /
analyzed: gzung ba med pa /
translated: It is ungraspable.

original: lus med pa de'i gnas ji lta bu zhig yod snyam mo //
analyzed: lus med pa de'i gnas ji lta bu zhig yod snyam mo //
translated: What kind of place is there for something that has no body?

original: sems kyis sems mi shes so //
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi shes so //
translated: The mind does not know the mind.

original: sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo //🔽gang la brten nas byung ba'i sems de'ang gzhan la rag las pa /
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo // gang la brten nas byung ba'i sems de'ang gzhan la rag las pa /
translated: The mind does not see the mind.

original: rang dbang med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rang dbang med par mthong ngo //
translated: The mind that arises in dependence on something else is seen to be powerless, not independent.

original: sems ma gtogs par byang chub kyang mi shes so //🔽de la byang chub sems @73a *//
analyzed: sems ma gtogs par byang chub kyang mi shes so // de la byang chub sems @73a *//
translated: Apart from the mind, awakening is not known.

original: tsam du shes pas sems la dbang thob bo //
analyzed: tsam du shes pas sems la dbang thob bo //
translated: In this regard, the mind is known to be just the mind, and so one gains power over the mind.

original: de sems la dbang bas theg pa chen po la dbang byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la'ang sems snyoms pa dang / theg pa chen po la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: de sems la dbang bas theg pa chen po la dbang byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la'ang sems snyoms pa dang / theg pa chen po la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa yin te /
translated: Through that power over the mind, one gains power over the Great Way, one’s mind becomes impartial toward all sentient beings, and one does not rely on others with regard to the Great Way.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ close placement of mindfulness of the mind.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'am /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'am /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ close placement of mindfulness of phenomena consist in?

original: mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'am /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas are mindful of what is wholesome and what is unwholesome.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'am /🔽kha na ma tho ba med pa'am /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'am / kha na ma tho ba med pa'am / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: with or without fault,

original: zag pa med pa'am /🔽'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'am / 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: with or without outflows,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /

analyzed: gang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa las rnam par grol ba dang / gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba dang / gang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa las rnam par grol ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see any dharma that is not born and does not cease, that is liberated from dependent origination, that is liberated from emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: chos thams cad ni smra ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni smra ba med pa ste /

original: brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can /

original: chos thams cad ni yi ge med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yi ge med pa ste /

analyzed: grangs thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /

original: chos thams cad ni drang ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni drang ba ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni rtsa ba rnam par byang ba'i phyir skyon med pa /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni lus med pa'i phyir 'ongs pa med pa /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir song ba med pa; chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi stong pa'i phyir chags pa med pa /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir stong pa /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba /

original: phyir ming tsam pa /
analyzed: phyir ming tsam pa /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir lta ba dang bral ba /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni lus med pa'i phyir bcings pa med pa / chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir grol ba med pa /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir thibs po med pa /

original: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir dbyings gcig pa; chos thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir tha mi dad do snyam du de ltar chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //

translated: All phenomena are undifferentiated, because they are the same as the limit of reality.

analyzed: de ltar chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can tha dad du mi byed /

analyzed: theg pa tha dad du mi byed /

analyzed: sangs rgyas tha dad du mi byed /

original: len pa med /
analyzed: len pa med /

original: 'dor ba med de /

analyzed: mi g-yo ba thob cing gnas pa yin te /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba la gnas pa de sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gzigs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston te /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: @74b de la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: dran pa des gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dran pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa / dri ma med pa /

analyzed: rnam par dag pa /

original: 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba /

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas ni sems can dang chos la tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ba ste /

analyzed: de dag gi dran pa rjes su dran pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs chen po mnga' ba /

original: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin @75b pa; sems can chen po'i gnas /

original: rnam par 'dren pa /
analyzed: rnam par 'dren pa /

original: chos kyi sku spyod yul ba /

analyzed: rtsod pa med pa'i chos kyi mchog dang ldan pa /

analyzed: rgya mtsho thams cad pas ches zab pa; ri rab thams cad pas ches mtho ba /

analyzed: sa bas ches brtan pa /

original: chu bas ches mnyen pa /
analyzed: chu bas ches mnyen pa /

original: me bas ches 'bar ba /🔽rlung bas ches chags pa med pa /
analyzed: me bas ches 'bar ba / rlung bas ches chags pa med pa /

original: nam mkha' bas ches dri ma med pa /

analyzed: chos ni skyabs yongs su tshol ba ma yin pas chos ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi skyabs yin te /

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: chos ni thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas chos ni gang la'ang thogs pa med de /
analyzed: chos ni thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas chos ni gang la'ang thogs pa med de /
translated: The Dharma has the characteristic of being unobstructed, so the Dharma is unobstructed by anything.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: chos ni bag la nyal med pas bag la nyal la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos ni bag la nyal med pas bag la nyal la mi 'jug ste /
translated: The Dharma is without latent tendencies, so it does not engage with latent tendencies.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: chos ni rtag tu rnam par mi rtog pas chos ni 'khor bas 'jigs skrag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: chos ni rtag tu rnam par mi rtog pas chos ni 'khor bas 'jigs skrag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The Dharma is always nonconceptual, so the Dharma is not frightened by saṃsāra

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su chags pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su chags pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: and is not attached to nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog pas de'i phyir chos rjes su dran pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog pas de'i phyir chos rjes su dran pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattvas establish mindfulness in a mind that is like the Dharma. Therefore it is called the recollection of the Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the close placement of mindfulness that is the bodhisatvas’ recollection of the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisatvas’ close placement of mindfulness that is the recollection of the Saṅgha?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here the bodhisatvas think as follows:

original: dge @78b 'dun ni chos smra ba /
analyzed: dge @78b 'dun ni chos smra ba /
translated: ‘The Saṅgha is the one who teaches the Dharma,

original: chos spyod pa /
analyzed: chos spyod pa /
translated: the one who practices the Dharma,

original: chos sems pa /
analyzed: chos sems pa /
translated: the one who contemplates the Dharma,

original: chos kyi zhing /🔽chos 'dzin pa /
analyzed: chos kyi zhing / chos 'dzin pa /
translated: the field of the Dharma,🔽the one who upholds the Dharma,

original: chos la rton pa /🔽chos la mchod pa /🔽chos kyi bya ba byed pa /
analyzed: chos la rton pa / chos la mchod pa / chos kyi bya ba byed pa /
translated: the one who relies on the Dharma,🔽the one who makes offerings to the Dharma,

original: chos spyod yul ba /
analyzed: chos spyod yul ba /
translated: the one who performs the Dharma,🔽the one who has the Dharma as his domain,🔽the one who is endowed with the practice of the Dharma,

original: chos spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa; rang bzhin gyis drang ba /
analyzed: chos spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa; rang bzhin gyis drang ba /
translated: the one who is naturally upright,

original: rang bzhin gyis dang ba /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dang ba /
translated: the one who is naturally clear,

original: snying rje ba'i chos can /
analyzed: snying rje ba'i chos can /
translated: the one who has the Dharma of compassion,

original: snying rje dang ldan pa /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa /
translated: the one who is endowed with compassion,

original: rtag tu dpen pa spyod yul ba /
analyzed: rtag tu dpen pa spyod yul ba /
translated: the one who always has solitude as his domain,

original: rtag tu chos la gzhol ba /
analyzed: rtag tu chos la gzhol ba /
translated: the one who always turns to the Dharma,

original: rtag tu dkar po spyod pa'o snyam mo; ;gzhan yang /
analyzed: rtag tu dkar po spyod pa'o snyam mo; ;gzhan yang /
translated: and the one who always practices what is good.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisatvas think as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun rnam pa du mar gsungs pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun rnam pa du mar gsungs pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One has taught many kinds of Saṅgha:

original: kun rdzob kyi dge 'dun dang / don dam pa'i dge 'dun dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i dge 'dun dang / ngo tsha med pa'i dge 'dun dang / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / cang shes kyi dge 'dun dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun no snyam mo //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi dge 'dun dang / don dam pa'i dge 'dun dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i dge 'dun dang / ngo tsha med pa'i dge 'dun dang / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / cang shes kyi dge 'dun dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun no snyam mo //
translated: the conventional Saṅgha, the ultimate Saṅgha, the Saṅgha of those with a sense of shame, the Saṅgha of those without a sense of shame, the Saṅgha of Noble Ones, the Saṅgha of those who are self-controlled, and the Saṅgha of those who are irreversible.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni kun rdzob kyi dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni kun rdzob kyi dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva practices in order to gather the conventional Saṅgha.

original: don dam pa'i dge 'dun la bsten pa'i phyir nan tan byed do //🔽ngo tsha shes pa'i dge 'dun rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dge 'dun la bsten pa'i phyir nan tan byed do // ngo tsha shes pa'i dge 'dun rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
translated: He practices in order to rely on the ultimate Saṅgha.🔽He practices in order to liberate the Saṅgha of those with a sense of shame.

original: ngo tsha med pa'i dge 'dun yongs su gdul ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa'i dge 'dun yongs su gdul ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
translated: He practices in order to guide the Saṅgha of those without a sense of shame.

original: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la mchod cing bsti stang bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la mchod cing bsti stang bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
translated: He practices in order to make offerings and show respect to the Saṅgha of Noble Ones.

original: cang shes kyi dge 'dun la sangs rgyas bzhin du nan tan byed do //
analyzed: cang shes kyi dge 'dun la sangs rgyas bzhin du nan tan byed do //
translated: He honors the community of those who are spiritually advanced, as if they were the Buddha himself.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun la chos kyi gtam gyi phyir nan tan byed do //🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam @79a *//
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun la chos kyi gtam gyi phyir nan tan byed do // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam @79a *//
translated: He honors the community of those who are irreversible, in order to receive the teachings.

original: du sems te /
analyzed: du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: rigs 'dzin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rigs 'dzin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: “The community of the Buddha’s sons is the family.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rab tu sbyin pa'i phyir zhing bzang po rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rab tu sbyin pa'i phyir zhing bzang po rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The community of the fields is the bestowal of the fruit of what is pleasing.

original: gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The community of the fearless is the freedom from bad actions.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa gtong zhing 'dor ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no; ;shin tu dul ba'i phyir cang shes pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa gtong zhing 'dor ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no; ;shin tu dul ba'i phyir cang shes pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The community of the liberated is the giving up of possessions. The community of those who are spiritually advanced is the complete self-control.

original: ma 'dres pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The community of those who are free from reactive emotions is the absence of confusion.

original: sdig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: sdig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are ashamed of evil, because they are free from evil.

original: bka' blo bde ba'i phyir slob ma rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bka' blo bde ba'i phyir slob ma rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of disciples, because they are obedient.

original: bdag yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag gis med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bdag yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag gis med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who have no self, because they are fully aware of no-self.

original: zhi ba'i phyir rgyags pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: zhi ba'i phyir rgyags pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are not arrogant, because they are tranquil.

original: 'dod pa nyung ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: 'dod pa nyung ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are not mistaken, because they have few desires.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are healthy, because they have cut off conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang dag par chad pa'i phyir nad med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no; ;pha rol tu son pa'i phyir thang la gnas pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang dag par chad pa'i phyir nad med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no; ;pha rol tu son pa'i phyir thang la gnas pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are on dry land, because they have reached the other shore.

original: thang la gnas pa'i phyir bde ba thob pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: thang la gnas pa'i phyir bde ba thob pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who have attained happiness, because they are on dry land.

original: de kho na mthong ba'i phyir bag yod pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba'i phyir bag yod pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are heedful, because they see reality.

original: skyon ma chags pa'i phyir dgon pa pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: skyon ma chags pa'i phyir dgon pa pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who live in the forest, because they are not attached to faults.

original: rgya che ba'i phyir byang chub la gzhol ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i phyir byang chub la gzhol ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are intent on enlightenment is the Saṅgha of those who are intent on the vast.

original: bslab pa gsum gyis bya ba shes @79b par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa 'dod pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa spyod yul ba'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyis bya ba shes @79b par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa 'dod pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa spyod yul ba'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who desire training is the Saṅgha of those who know how to act through the three trainings.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are mindful is the Saṅgha of those who have the four establishments of mindfulness as their domain.

original: yang dag par spong ba spyod yul ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa spyod yul ba'i phyir ngal ba med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba spyod yul ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa spyod yul ba'i phyir ngal ba med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who have begun to make an effort is the Saṅgha of those who have the four right efforts as their domain.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are tireless is the Saṅgha of those who have the four bases of supernatural power as their domain.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are inseparable is the Saṅgha of those who have the five faculties as their domain.

original: dbang po spyod yul ba'i phyir mi phyed pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no; ;stobs spyod yul ba'i phyir tsher ma dkrugs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dbang po spyod yul ba'i phyir mi phyed pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no; ;stobs spyod yul ba'i phyir tsher ma dkrugs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who do not disturb the thorns is the Saṅgha of those who have the five powers as their domain.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag spyod yul ba'i phyir bsgrib pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag spyod yul ba'i phyir bsgrib pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are free from obscurations is the Saṅgha of those who have the seven factors of awakening as their domain.

original: lam spyod yul ba'i phyir yang dag par lta ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: lam spyod yul ba'i phyir yang dag par lta ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who have the right view, because they practice the path.

original: bden pa spyod yul ba'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bden pa spyod yul ba'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of the Noble Ones, because they practice the truth.

original: bsam gtan spyod yul ba'i phyir mnyam par bzhag pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bsam gtan spyod yul ba'i phyir mnyam par bzhag pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are concentrated, because they practice meditation.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba spyod yul ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba spyod yul ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who turn the wheel of the Dharma, because they practice dependent origination.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are irreversible, because they have great compassion.

original: bsod nams thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no snyam mo //
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no snyam mo //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are impeded by one life, because they have accumulated the provisions of all merit.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dge 'dun rjes su dran pas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dge 'dun rjes su dran pas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “In this regard, the bodhisattva who is recollecting the Saṅgha thinks as follows:

original: gang dge 'dun gyi yang dag pa'i yon tan de dag ni bdag dang / sems can thams cad kyis kyang bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems @80a *//
analyzed: gang dge 'dun gyi yang dag pa'i yon tan de dag ni bdag dang / sems can thams cad kyis kyang bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems @80a *//
translated: “May I and all sentient beings accomplish those excellent qualities of the Saṅgha!”

original: dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the close placement of mindfulness that is the recollection of the Saṅgha.🔽“What is the close placement of mindfulness that is the recollection of morality?

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here a bodhisattva considers thus:

original: gang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni tshul khrims las byung bar blta'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni tshul khrims las byung bar blta'o //
translated: ‘Whatever mundane and supramundane perfections there are, all of them should be seen as arising from morality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: tshul khrims ni phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad kyi gnas yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad kyi gnas yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: Because morality is the basis of all those perfections.

original: dper na / sa ni sman dang / rtsva dang / nags tshal thams cad kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: dper na / sa ni sman dang / rtsva dang / nags tshal thams cad kyi gnas yin no //
translated: It is like, for example, the earth, which is the basis of all medicinal herbs, grasses, and forests.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyang phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyang phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad kyi gnas yin no //
translated: Likewise, morality is the basis of all those perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi gnas la rab tu gnas pa ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi gnas la rab tu gnas pa ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the basis of morality is a field of merit for the world with its gods.

original: sbyin pa'i chos yongs su rdzogs par yang byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i chos yongs su rdzogs par yang byed do //
translated: He also perfects the quality of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi gnas la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gnas la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dga' ba skye'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the basis of morality experiences joy.

original: yid dga' bas 'gyod pa med do //
analyzed: yid dga' bas 'gyod pa med do //
translated: With a joyful mind, he has no regrets.

original: 'gyod pa med pas mchog tu dga' ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pas mchog tu dga' ba 'thob bo //
translated: Without regrets, he experiences supreme joy.

original: mchog tu dga' bas lus dang / sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' bas lus dang / sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: With supreme joy, his body and mind become fit.

original: lus dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pas bde ste ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
analyzed: lus dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pas bde ste ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
translated: With a fit body and mind, he experiences bliss and attains concentration.

original: yid mnyam par bzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: yid mnyam par bzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba yin no //
translated: With his mind concentrated, he sees things as they really are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i @80b byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'jug go snyam mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i @80b byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'jug go snyam mo //
translated: The bodhisattva who sees things as they really are will feel great compassion for sentient beings.

original: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He will think:

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad la ting nge 'dzin  'di dang / chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba bsgrub par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la ting nge 'dzin  'di dang / chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba bsgrub par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I must help all sentient beings to attain this meditative absorption and to see things as they really are.

original: de snying rje chen po des bskul bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la bslab pa yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de snying rje chen po des bskul bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la bslab pa yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: And so, urged on by great compassion, he will complete the training in superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom, and will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: de bas na bdag gis kyang tshul khrims la gnas pa mi bskyod pa mi lhod par bya'o; ;sems can thams cad mngon du byas nas tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis kyang tshul khrims la gnas pa mi bskyod pa mi lhod par bya'o; ;sems can thams cad mngon du byas nas tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o snyam mo //
translated: Therefore, I too should be steadfast in my morality, without laxity, and should practice morality with all sentient beings in mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims de ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i gnas la mi gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims de ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i gnas la mi gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that bodhisattva morality does not stand in a place that is not beneficial and happy for all sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva thinks like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims ni gnod sems med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims ni gnod sems med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: “The morality of a bodhisattva’s renunciation fulfills the perfection of non-violence.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu byung ba'i tshul khrims ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu byung ba'i tshul khrims ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of a bodhisattva’s going forth fulfills the perfection of giving away all possessions.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang sdom pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang sdom pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of a bodhisattva’s taking up the trainings and vows

original: lus dang / ngag dang / sems yongs su dag pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / sems yongs su dag pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: fulfills the perfection of the purification of body, speech, and mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par sems pa'i @81a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par sems pa'i @81a *//
translated: The morality of a bodhisattva’s definite reflection

original: tshul khrims ni mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: fulfills the perfection of the six superknowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyan pa'i tshul khrims ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do // byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyan pa'i tshul khrims ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva's right concentration brings to completion the factors of enlightenment.🔽The morality of the bodhisattva's study of the Dharma brings to completion the four right efforts.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i thos pa yongs su tshol ba'i tshul khrims ni nga rgyal med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i thos pa yongs su tshol ba'i tshul khrims ni nga rgyal med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva's search for learning brings to completion the four analytical knowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i tshul khrims ni yon tan gyi chos thams cad chud mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i tshul khrims ni yon tan gyi chos thams cad chud mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva's service to spiritual benefactors brings to completion the non-loss of all good qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva's practice of the transcendences brings to completion the gnosis of omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa'i tshul khrims ni chos smra ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa'i tshul khrims ni chos smra ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva in teaching the Dharma as he has heard it fulfills the perfection of being a Dharma teacher.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni gzungs dang / spobs pa thob pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi tshul khrims ni skye ba thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni gzungs dang / spobs pa thob pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi tshul khrims ni skye ba thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva in teaching the Dharma as he has heard it fulfills the perfection of eloquence and retention.🔽The morality of the bodhisattva in the thought of enlightenment fulfills the perfection of passing beyond all states of existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi sems @81b chud mi za bar yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi sems @81b chud mi za bar yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva in being free from anger toward any living being fulfills the perfection of never losing the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems chud mi za ba'i tshul khrims ni dkon mchog gsum chud mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam mo; ;de'ang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems chud mi za ba'i tshul khrims ni dkon mchog gsum chud mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam mo; ;de'ang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: And he thinks:

original: tshul khrims bsrungs pas bsrung ba thams cad bsrungs pa yin no snyam pa 'di ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs pas bsrung ba thams cad bsrungs pa yin no snyam pa 'di ni /
translated: ‘By protecting morality, I protect all that is to be protected.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble sir,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas’ application of mindfulness to morality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gtong ba rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gtong ba rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you ask, is the bodhisattvas’ application of mindfulness to generosity?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here a bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gang ci gtong ba de thams cad ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang ci gtong ba de thams cad ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: Whatever is given, all of it🔽is included in two kinds of giving:

original: zang zing gi gtong ba dang / chos kyi gtong ba dang / gtong ba rnam pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus so snyam mo //
analyzed: zang zing gi gtong ba dang / chos kyi gtong ba dang / gtong ba rnam pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus so snyam mo //
translated: material gifts and the gift of the Dharma.

original: de la zang zing gi gtong bas ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po yongs su skor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de la zang zing gi gtong bas ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po yongs su skor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By giving material things, the bodhisattva perfects the purity of the adornment of the major and minor marks, the purity of the purification of the buddha-land, and the purity of the development of beings.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By giving the teaching, he perfects the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: bag chags kyang yang dag par 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: bag chags kyang yang dag par 'joms par byed do //
translated: And he completely destroys the instinctual habit-energy.

original: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni phung po thams cad nges par 'dor bar byed do //🔽chos kyi gtong bas ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams @82a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni phung po thams cad nges par 'dor bar byed do // chos kyi gtong bas ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams @82a *//
translated: Moreover, by giving material things, he gives up all the aggregates.

original: cad kyi sa las yang dag par 'da'o //
analyzed: cad kyi sa las yang dag par 'da'o //
translated: By giving the teaching, he transcends the stages of the disciples and the solitary sages.

original: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni skye ba'i lus yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni skye ba'i lus yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, by giving material things, he purifies the body in which he is reborn.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni chos kyi sku yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni chos kyi sku yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: And by the gift of Dharma, the Dharma Body is purified.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zang zing gi gtong bas ni pha ma las byung ba'i stobs sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zang zing gi gtong bas ni pha ma las byung ba'i stobs sgrub par byed de /
translated: by the gift of material things, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes the strength that comes from parents.

original: stobs de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par su la'ang med do //
analyzed: stobs de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par su la'ang med do //
translated: That strength does not exist in anyone except the Tathāgatas and bodhisattvas dwelling on the tenth ground.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs sgrub par byed de /
translated: By the gift of Dharma, he accomplishes the strength of miraculous powers.

original: stobs de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par su la'ang med do //
analyzed: stobs de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par su la'ang med do //
translated: That strength does not exist in anyone except the Tathāgatas and bodhisattvas dwelling on the tenth ground.

original: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Moreover, by the gift of material things, he brings [beings] to maturity.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni rnam par thar bar byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni rnam par thar bar byed do //
translated: By the gift of Dharma, he liberates [them].

original: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni tshogs gsag go /
analyzed: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni tshogs gsag go /
translated: Moreover, by the gift of material things, he accumulates the accumulations.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni sgrol lo //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni sgrol lo //
translated: And through the giving of Dharma, one is liberated.

original: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni nor yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni nor yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: Moreover, through the giving of material things, one gives away wealth.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni thams cad gtong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni thams cad gtong ngo //
translated: And through the giving of Dharma, one gives away everything.

original: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / zang zing gi gtong bas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: Moreover, through the giving of material things, one accomplishes liberation from the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: And through the giving of Dharma, one accomplishes liberation from the obscurations to omniscience.

original: gzhan yang / gtong ba gtong ba zhes bya ba 'di ni yongs su rtog pa gtong ba'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gtong ba gtong ba zhes bya ba 'di ni yongs su rtog pa gtong ba'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: Moreover, this “giving of giving” is a term for the giving up of conceptualization.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yongs @82b su rtog pa gtong ba de ni gtong ba rnams kyi dam pa'o //
analyzed: yongs @82b su rtog pa gtong ba de ni gtong ba rnams kyi dam pa'o //
translated: The giving up of conceptualization is the highest giving.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: yongs su rtog pa btang bas byang chub sems dpa' dag pa zhes bya'o //🔽smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa btang bas byang chub sems dpa' dag pa zhes bya'o // smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Because by giving up conceptualization, bodhisattvas are said to be pure.🔽”

original: yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di gang gi tshig bla dvags /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di gang gi tshig bla dvags /
translated: “Son of noble family, what is this ‘conceptualization’ of which you speak?🔽”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

analyzed: yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las sgro btags pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: “Conceptualization” is a term that refers to the superimposition of something that is not real and does not exist.

original: smras pa / ji ltar na yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las sgro btags pa yin /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar na yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las sgro btags pa yin /
translated: ” “How is it that it is the superimposition of something that is not real and does not exist? ”

original: smras pa / nam 'di ltar bdag ni chags pa /
analyzed: smras pa / nam 'di ltar bdag ni chags pa /
translated: ” “When one superimposes the thought ‘I am attached,

original: bdag ni zhe sdang ba /🔽bdag ni gti mug pa /
analyzed: bdag ni zhe sdang ba / bdag ni gti mug pa /
translated: I am hateful,🔽I am confused,

original: bdag ni nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: bdag ni nyon mongs pa /
translated: I am afflicted,

original: bdag ni rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: bdag ni rnam par dag pa /
translated: I am purified,

original: bdag ni bcings pa /
analyzed: bdag ni bcings pa /
translated: I am bound,

original: bdag ni grol ba /
analyzed: bdag ni grol ba /
translated: I am liberated,

original: bdag ni 'khor ba /
analyzed: bdag ni 'khor ba /
translated: I am in cyclic existence,

original: bdag ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o snyam pa la sogs par sgro btags pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las yongs su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o snyam pa la sogs par sgro btags pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las yongs su brtags pa'o //
translated: I am in nirvāṇa,’ and so on, all of that is the superimposition of something that is not real and does not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ” “Why is that? ”

original: 'di dag thams cad ni rgyu dang / rkyen tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni rgyu dang / rkyen tsam ste /
translated: “All of this is merely a cause and a condition.

original: 'di la bdag dang / bdag gi med /
analyzed: 'di la bdag dang / bdag gi med /
translated: Here there is no self and no mine,

original: sems can med /🔽srog med / gang zag med /🔽shes las skyes med /
analyzed: sems can med / srog med / gang zag med / shes las skyes med /
translated: no sentient being,🔽no life-force, no person,

original: shed bu med do //
analyzed: shed bu med do //
translated: no one who is born, and no one who dies.🔽There is no one who is afflicted, and no one who is purified.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dben pa /

analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from mind, mentality, and consciousness,

original: mi sems pa /
analyzed: mi sems pa /
translated: not thinking,

original: yongs su mi rtog pa /
analyzed: yongs su mi rtog pa /
translated: not conceptualizing,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa /
translated: not afflicted,

original: rnam par byang ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma yin pa /
translated: not purified,

original: 'khor ba ma yin pa /🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'das @83a *//
analyzed: 'khor ba ma yin pa / yongs su mya ngan las 'das @83a *//
translated: not saṃsāra,

analyzed: pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' yod pa ma yin pa la sgro mi 'dogs shing /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not superimpose existence on that,

analyzed: de sgro 'dogs pa btang bas gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because they abandon that superimposition, it is called ‘the perfection of generosity.’

analyzed: nam chos de dag rjes su dran pa de ni de'i gtong ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When they recollect those dharmas, it is called ‘the recollection of generosity.’

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family,

analyzed: gtong ba dang / gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba'o //
translated: generosity, great generosity, and utter generosity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtong ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ giving?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bza' ba 'dod pa rnams la bza' ba sbyin pa dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / mar me dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang /
analyzed: bza' ba 'dod pa rnams la bza' ba sbyin pa dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / mar me dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang /
translated: Giving food to those who desire food, and giving drink, vehicles, clothing, lamps, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, clothing,

analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / shing rta dang; rgyan la sogs pa sbyin pa ste /
