original: thams cad ces bya ba ni mig dang / gzugs dang / rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang; lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang / chos rnams te /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni mig dang / gzugs dang / rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang; lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang / chos rnams te /
translated: all phenomena are the eye and visual forms, the ear and sounds, the nose and smells, the tongue and tastes, the body and touchable things, and the mind and mental phenomena.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de dag ni gang rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / smig rgyu dang / mgal me bskor ba dang; skra shad 'dzings pa lta bu dang / sprul pa dang / brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur blta bar bya ba'i shes pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de dag ni gang rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / smig rgyu dang / mgal me bskor ba dang; skra shad 'dzings pa lta bu dang / sprul pa dang / brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur blta bar bya ba'i shes pa thams cad do //
translated: all of these are the consciousnesses that should be seen as being like a dream, an illusion, a city of gandharvas, a mirage, a whirling firebrand, a braid of hair, a magical creation, an echo, or a reflection.

original: de la 'dzin pa ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams so //
translated: The apprehender is the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: gzung ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams te /
analyzed: gzung ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams te /
translated: The apprehended is form, sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects.

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i chos 'di dag rnam pa dang / tshul thams cad kyis shes pa dang / khong du chud pa dang / ston nus pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i chos 'di dag rnam pa dang / tshul thams cad kyis shes pa dang / khong du chud pa dang / ston nus pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is able to know, understand, and teach all of these phenomena of the apprehended and the apprehender in all their aspects and modes is called omniscient.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni bag la nyal ba med pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni bag la nyal ba med pa /
translated: The omniscient one is free of latent tendencies,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa /
translated: free of afflictions,

original: ngar 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: free of grasping at an “I,”🔽and free of grasping at “mine.”

original: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: He is without grasping at “mine.”

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
translated: He is equal to space.

original: mi 'gyur ba /🔽sems can thams cad la @91b sems mnyam pa /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba / sems can thams cad la @91b sems mnyam pa /
translated: He is unchanging.🔽He has an attitude of equality toward all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He has a mind that benefits all sentient beings.

original: thams cad du dben pa'i sems dang ldan pa /🔽thams cad du lhun gyis grub pa /
analyzed: thams cad du dben pa'i sems dang ldan pa / thams cad du lhun gyis grub pa /
translated: He has a mind that is isolated from everything.🔽He is spontaneously present in everything.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i chos can /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i chos can /
translated: He is spontaneously present.

original: sems can gyi snying po /
analyzed: sems can gyi snying po /
translated: He is the essence of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dam pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dam pa /
translated: He is the best of all sentient beings.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i chos can /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i chos can /
translated: He is free from obscurations.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: He has great compassion.

original: mi bskyod pa'i chos can /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i chos can /
translated: He is unshakable.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the perfect, complete Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtsom pa med kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtsom pa med kyis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Akṣayamati said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid 'di khong du chud par 'tshal bas ji lta bur bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid 'di khong du chud par 'tshal bas ji lta bur bgyi /
translated: how should bodhisattvas who wish to understand this reality of the blessed buddhas proceed?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid 'di khong du chud par 'dod pas sems can thams cad kyi ngan du byas pa dang / mi snyan pa thams cad bzod par bya ba'i phyir sems dang mtshungs par bya'o //🔽bdag dang / sems can gzhan rnams kyi rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad bkur ba'i phyir sems chu dang mtshungs par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid 'di khong du chud par 'dod pas sems can thams cad kyi ngan du byas pa dang / mi snyan pa thams cad bzod par bya ba'i phyir sems dang mtshungs par bya'o // bdag dang / sems can gzhan rnams kyi rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad bkur ba'i phyir sems chu dang mtshungs par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to understand this reality of the Blessed Buddhas should have a mind like water in order to bear all the evils and insults of all sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis bdag dang / sems can gzhan rnams kyi las dang / nyon mongs pa'i rtsi shing bsreg pa'i phyir sems me dang mtshungs par bya'o //🔽chags pa thams cad dang dbral ba'i @92a *//🔽ba'i phyir sems rlung dang mtshungs par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis bdag dang / sems can gzhan rnams kyi las dang / nyon mongs pa'i rtsi shing bsreg pa'i phyir sems me dang mtshungs par bya'o // chags pa thams cad dang dbral ba'i @92a *// ba'i phyir sems rlung dang mtshungs par bya'o //
translated: He should have a mind like fire in order to burn up with wisdom all the afflictions of conceptual thought and discursive thought of himself and others.🔽He should have a mind like wind in order to be unattached to all things.

original: thams cad du sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sems nam mkha' dang mtshungs par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sems nam mkha' dang mtshungs par bya'o //
translated: He should have a mind like space in order to be of the nature of universal nonobstruction.

original: thams cad du 'jigs pa med cing skrag pa med pas byang chub sems dpas seng ge dang mtshungs par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'jigs pa med cing skrag pa med pas byang chub sems dpas seng ge dang mtshungs par bya'o //
translated: In all things, being fearless and without anxiety, the bodhisattva should be like a lion.

original: shin tu dul ba'i sems can thams cad kyi khur khyer ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas glang po che dang mtshungs par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu dul ba'i sems can thams cad kyi khur khyer ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas glang po che dang mtshungs par bya'o //
translated: In carrying the burden of all well-disciplined beings, the bodhisattva should be like a beast of burden.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bebs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas sprin lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bebs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas sprin lta bur bya'o //
translated: In bringing down the rain of the holy Dharma, the bodhisattva should be like a rain cloud.

original: sems can thams cad la ye shes kyis snang bar byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas nyi ma lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la ye shes kyis snang bar byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas nyi ma lta bur bya'o //
translated: In illuminating all beings with wisdom, the bodhisattva should be like the sun.

original: thams cad du sems can thams cad la rtag tu bde bar snang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zla ba lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du sems can thams cad la rtag tu bde bar snang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zla ba lta bur bya'o //
translated: In always bringing light to all beings everywhere, the bodhisattva should be like the moon.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rin po che'i gling chen por phyogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ded dpon lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rin po che'i gling chen por phyogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ded dpon lta bur bya'o //
translated: In setting out for the great island of jewels, the knowledge of a buddha, the bodhisattva should be like a caravan leader.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad gso ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas sman pa lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad gso ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas sman pa lta bur bya'o //
translated: For the sake of healing all the sicknesses of the afflictions of all sentient beings, a bodhisattva should be like a doctor.

original: sems can thams cad kyi chos la the tshom za ba'i zug rdu 'don pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zug rdu 'byin pa lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi chos la the tshom za ba'i zug rdu 'don pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zug rdu 'byin pa lta bur bya'o //
translated: For the sake of removing the splinters of doubt about the Dharma from all sentient beings, a bodhisattva should be like a surgeon.🔽For the sake of skill in the direction of omniscient wisdom, a bodhisattva should be like a helmsman.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phyogs la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas gdos pa 'dzin pa lta bur @92b bya'o; ;'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sems can sgrol ba la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas gru lta bur bya'o //🔽sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar gyur pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas stegs bu lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phyogs la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas gdos pa 'dzin pa lta bur @92b bya'o; ;'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sems can sgrol ba la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas gru lta bur bya'o // sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar gyur pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas stegs bu lta bur bya'o //
translated: For the sake of skill in liberating sentient beings from the ocean of cyclic existence, a bodhisattva should be like a boat.🔽For the sake of being the livelihood of all sentient beings, a bodhisattva should be like a bridge.

original: sems can thams cad mtshungs par 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas lam po che lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mtshungs par 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas lam po che lta bur bya'o //
translated: For the sake of the equal engagement of all sentient beings, a bodhisattva should be like a highway.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rin po che thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rin po che'i gling lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rin po che thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rin po che'i gling lta bur bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva should be like an island, because of the perfection of all the jewels of the factors of enlightenment.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che 'dra bar bsam pa thams cad yongs su skong ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che 'dra bar bsam pa thams cad yongs su skong ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bur bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva should be like a wish-fulfilling gem, because of fulfilling all wishes.

original: legs par byas pa'i las byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas cang shes su bya'o //
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas cang shes su bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva should be like a thoroughbred, because of performing well-done actions.

original: shes rab zab cing gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rgya mtsho lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab zab cing gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rgya mtsho lta bur bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva should be like the ocean, because of the depth and difficulty of fathoming his wisdom.🔽“The bodhisattva should be like Mount Meru, because of the unshakability of his intention toward the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub las bsam pa mi g-yo ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ri rab dang mtshungs par bya'o; ;kun nas mdzes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dpag bsam gyi shing lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub las bsam pa mi g-yo ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ri rab dang mtshungs par bya'o; ;kun nas mdzes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dpag bsam gyi shing lta bur bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva should be like a wish-fulfilling tree, because of his beauty.

original: mthong bar dka' ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dzambu'i chu bo'i gser 'dra bar bya'o; ;chos la dbang thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas brgya byin lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: mthong bar dka' ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dzambu'i chu bo'i gser 'dra bar bya'o; ;chos la dbang thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas brgya byin lta bur bya'o //
translated: In order to be difficult to see, a bodhisattva should be like the gold of the Jambū River. In order to attain mastery of the Dharma, a bodhisattva should be like Śakra.

original: rab tu zhi ba'i spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas tshangs pa lta bur @93a *//
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas tshangs pa lta bur @93a *//
translated: In order to be endowed with a peaceful demeanor, a bodhisattva should be like Brahmā.

original: bya'o; ;dam pa'i chos yongs su skyong ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten skyong ba lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o; ;dam pa'i chos yongs su skyong ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten skyong ba lta bur bya'o //
translated: In order to protect the sublime Dharma, a bodhisattva should be like a world protector.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bsten pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'khor los bsgyur ba lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bsten pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'khor los bsgyur ba lta bur bya'o //
translated: In order to rely on the path of the ten virtuous actions, a bodhisattva should be like a universal monarch.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsang ba 'dzin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas blon po chen po lta bur bya'o; ;dge sbyong la gnas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mngon par 'byung ba la dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsang ba 'dzin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas blon po chen po lta bur bya'o; ;dge sbyong la gnas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mngon par 'byung ba la dga' bar bya'o //
translated: In order to uphold the secrets of the blessed buddhas, a bodhisattva should be like a great minister. In order to abide as an ascetic, a bodhisattva should delight in going forth.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / sems zhi ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dge sbyong du bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / sems zhi ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dge sbyong du bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should be an ascetic because of the peace of body, speech, and mind.

original: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dgon pa par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dgon pa par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should be a hermit because of the perfection of meditation, concentration, meditative absorption, superknowledge, knowledge, and liberation.

original: stong pa nyid rtogs pa khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpas bsam gtan par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtogs pa khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpas bsam gtan par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should be a meditator because of the realization of emptiness.

original: mi'am ci dang / lto phye chen po dang / rig sngags 'chang grub pa 'dul ba la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dben pa la mngon par dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi'am ci dang / lto phye chen po dang / rig sngags 'chang grub pa 'dul ba la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dben pa la mngon par dga' bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should delight in solitude because of the skill in subduing the Kinnaras, Mahakayas, and accomplished Vidyadharas.

original: rig pa gsum rtogs par khong du chud pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rig sngags 'chang du bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa gsum rtogs par khong du chud pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rig sngags 'chang du bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should be a Vidyadhara because of the realization of the three knowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa drug thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mngon par shes pa'i ye shes su bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mngon par shes pa'i ye shes su bya'o //
translated: In order to attain the six superknowledges, the bodhisattva should practice the knowledge of the superknowledges.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / @93b skye mched la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mang du thos par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / @93b skye mched la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mang du thos par bya'o //
translated: In order to be skilled in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, the bodhisattva should study much.

original: bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas slob dpon du bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas slob dpon du bya'o //
translated: In order to be skilled in all treatises, the bodhisattva should be a teacher.

original: zang zing med par chos ston pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas chos smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: zang zing med par chos ston pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas chos smra bar bya'o //
translated: In order to teach the Dharma without material gain, the bodhisattva should be a Dharma teacher.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug btul ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'dul ba 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug btul ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'dul ba 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: In order to subdue desire, anger, and ignorance, the bodhisattva should uphold the Vinaya.

original: thams cad du rung ba la tshod shes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ma mo 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rung ba la tshod shes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ma mo 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: In order to know the measure of everything suitable, the bodhisattva should be a caretaker of the monastery.

original: tshol ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dul bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshol ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas dul bar bya'o //
translated: In order to be free from all seeking, the bodhisattva should be disciplined.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mi rgod par bya'o //🔽zhe sdang dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ma khengs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mi rgod par bya'o // zhe sdang dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ma khengs par bya'o //
translated: In order to be free from desire, a bodhisattva should not be lustful.🔽In order to be free from hatred, a bodhisattva should not be arrogant.

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mu cor mi smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mu cor mi smra bar bya'o //
translated: In order to be free from delusion, a bodhisattva should not be garrulous.

original: ngag bsngams pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' tshig 'chol bar mi smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngag bsngams pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' tshig 'chol bar mi smra bar bya'o //
translated: In order to be restrained in speech, a bodhisattva should not be loose-lipped.🔽In order to lead to the Great Vehicle, a bodhisattva should be like a caravan leader.

original: theg pa chen po la 'dzud pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ded dpon du bya'o; ;byang chub tu dam bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas khur rtsa ba lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'dzud pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ded dpon du bya'o; ;byang chub tu dam bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas khur rtsa ba lta bur bya'o //
translated: In order to fulfill the vow to awaken, a bodhisattva should be like the root of a burden.

original: sems can thams cad brten pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas skyed mos tshal 'dra bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad brten pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas skyed mos tshal 'dra bar bya'o //
translated: In order to support all beings, a bodhisattva should be like a park.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi zong yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas grong khyer lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi zong yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas grong khyer lta bur bya'o //
translated: In order to perfect the merchandise of omniscient wisdom, a bodhisattva should be like a city.

original: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa @94a *//🔽bzhin du byams pa dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas phan pa 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa @94a *// bzhin du byams pa dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas phan pa 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Because he loves all beings as if each were his only child, the Bodhisattva should be a benefactor.

original: sems can thams cad kyi ci bya ba yongs su thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas bran lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ci bya ba yongs su thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas bran lta bur bya'o //
translated: Because he has attained the status of being the servant of all beings, the Bodhisattva should be like a servant.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rma rgod dag la drang ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rma rgod dag la drang ba rnams yin no //
translated: the bodhisattvas are honest with the deceitful.

original: khengs pa dag la nga rgyal med pa rnams yin no //🔽g-yo can dag la g-yo med pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: khengs pa dag la nga rgyal med pa rnams yin no // g-yo can dag la g-yo med pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are free of pride toward the arrogant.🔽They are without deceit toward the deceitful.

original: thibs po spyod pa dag la sgyu med pa dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: thibs po spyod pa dag la sgyu med pa dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are full of guile toward those who act in a thicket of vines.

original: log par zhugs pa dag la snying rje dang ldan pa rnams yin no //🔽ngo tsha med pa dag la ngo tsha dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa dag la snying rje dang ldan pa rnams yin no // ngo tsha med pa dag la ngo tsha dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are compassionate toward those who have gone astray.🔽They are full of shame toward the shameless.

original: mu cor smra ba dag la khrel yod pa phun sum tshogs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mu cor smra ba dag la khrel yod pa phun sum tshogs pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are full of propriety toward the prattle-mongers.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad la sems spam gong ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad la sems spam gong ba rnams yin no //
translated: They are not intimidated by any adversaries.

original: 'khor thams cad la bag tsha ba med pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'khor thams cad la bag tsha ba med pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are not afraid of any assemblies.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are unstained by any worldly things.

original: bdud thams cad kyis mi 'phogs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis mi 'phogs pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are not disturbed by any demons.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi thul ba rnams yin no //🔽bla ma dag la gus pa dang bcas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi thul ba rnams yin no // bla ma dag la gus pa dang bcas pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are not defeated by any adversaries.🔽They are respectful to their gurus.

original: 'phags pa dag la zhes dang bcas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag la zhes dang bcas pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are respectful to the āryas.

original: mang du thos pa dag la ri mor byed pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mang du thos pa dag la ri mor byed pa rnams yin no //
translated: They honor those with much learning.

original: bsam gtan dag la ngo mtshar thob pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag la ngo mtshar thob pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are amazed by the dhyānas.

original: mkhas pa dag la lhag pa'i bsam pa 'jug @94b pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag la lhag pa'i bsam pa 'jug @94b pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are motivated to be skilled.

original: chos smra ba dag la sangs rgyas tsam du phangs par sems pa dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: chos smra ba dag la sangs rgyas tsam du phangs par sems pa dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
translated: They think of Dharma teachers as being as precious as the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag la skyabs su song ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag la skyabs su song ba rnams yin no //
translated: They have taken refuge in the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas dag la bsam pa thams cad kyis zhugs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dag la bsam pa thams cad kyis zhugs pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are the ones who have entered into all the thoughts of the Buddhas.

original: nan tan dag la snying por 'du shes pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: nan tan dag la snying por 'du shes pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are the ones who perceive the essence of practice.🔽They are the ones who are fearless in the face of all reactive emotions.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi 'jigs pa rnams yin no; ;snying rje chen po la phyogs pas mya ngan las 'das pa la mi lta ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi 'jigs pa rnams yin no; ;snying rje chen po la phyogs pas mya ngan las 'das pa la mi lta ba rnams yin no //
translated: They are the ones who do not look to nirvāṇa, because they are oriented towards great compassion.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa la mngon par dga' bas 'khor ba la phyogs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa la mngon par dga' bas 'khor ba la phyogs pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are the ones who are oriented towards saṃsāra, because they delight in bringing all sentient beings to full maturity.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti thams cad la mi lta bas zang zing med par chos ston pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti thams cad la mi lta bas zang zing med par chos ston pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are the ones who teach the Dharma without concern for material things, because they do not look to any material gain or honor.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba yongs su shes pas sems phyin ci ma log pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba yongs su shes pas sems phyin ci ma log pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are the ones whose minds are not distorted, because they understand impermanence, suffering, no-self, and impurity.

original: yul thams cad la mi lta bas sems rnam par grol ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: yul thams cad la mi lta bas sems rnam par grol ba rnams yin no //
translated: They are the ones whose minds are liberated, because they do not look to any object.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs su skyes pas rigs phun sum tshogs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs su skyes pas rigs phun sum tshogs pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are endowed with the best of spiritual genes, because they are born into the family of the noble ones.

original: rab tu byung ba mang bas blo phun sum tshogs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba mang bas blo phun sum tshogs pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are endowed with the best of minds, because they have many who have gone forth.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pas 'phags pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pas 'phags pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are noble ones, because they know suffering, its origination, its cessation, and the path.

original: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / bag yod pa la gnas pas skyes bu dam pa rnams yin no //🔽'du byed bdag med par yongs su shes pa dang ldan @95a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / bag yod pa la gnas pas skyes bu dam pa rnams yin no // 'du byed bdag med par yongs su shes pa dang ldan @95a *//
translated: They are holy beings, because they abide in morality, learning, and conscientiousness.

original: pas sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: pas sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are impartial toward all beings, because they are endowed with the knowledge that the constituents of reality are insubstantial.

original: 'phags pa'i phyag rgyas btab pas log par mi ltung ba'i chos can rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i phyag rgyas btab pas log par mi ltung ba'i chos can rnams yin no //
translated: They are not subject to falling back, because they are sealed by the noble ones’ way of life.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i phyag rgyas btab pas byang chub kyi snying por gzhol ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i phyag rgyas btab pas byang chub kyi snying por gzhol ba rnams yin no //
translated: They are headed for the site of awakening, because they are sealed by the irreversible stage.

original: spyod lam mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu gtsang ma yang dag par spyod pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: spyod lam mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu gtsang ma yang dag par spyod pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are the bodhisattvas who are always pure and practice well with perfect, beautiful conduct.

original: 'jig rten gyi gsang tshig la mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gsang tshig la mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not delight in the secret talk of the world.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po la mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po la mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not delight in bad friends.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not delight in gain, honor, or praise.

original: 'du 'dzi dag la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi dag la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to crowds.

original: yul rgyus kyi gtam dang / rgyal po'i gtam dang / chom rkun gyi gtam dang / bud med kyi gtam dang / gzhad gad kyi gtam dang / dmag gi gtam dang / 'thab cing rtsod pa'i gtam la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul rgyus kyi gtam dang / rgyal po'i gtam dang / chom rkun gyi gtam dang / bud med kyi gtam dang / gzhad gad kyi gtam dang / dmag gi gtam dang / 'thab cing rtsod pa'i gtam la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to talk about the country, talk about the king, talk about thieves, talk about women, talk about jokes, talk about armies, or talk about fighting and disputes.

original: yul ngan pa dang / ljongs ngan pa dang / yul 'khor ngan pa dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / tshong dus dang / ri brag ngan pa rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ngan pa dang / ljongs ngan pa dang / yul 'khor ngan pa dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / tshong dus dang / ri brag ngan pa rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to bad countries, bad regions, bad kingdoms, bad towns, bad cities, bad markets, or bad mountains.

original: gar dang / bro dang / bzhad gad dang / glu la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gar dang / bro dang / bzhad gad dang / glu la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to dance, song, music, and laughter.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can ser sna can rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can ser sna can rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: bodhisattvas are not attached to stingy sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams dang / mtshams @95b so sor bcad pa rnams dang / rgyun sman du gyur pa rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams dang / mtshams @95b so sor bcad pa rnams dang / rgyun sman du gyur pa rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to those with faulty discipline, those who have set boundaries, or those who have become renunciants.

original: gnod sems kyi tha ba dang / zhe sdang mang ba rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi tha ba dang / zhe sdang mang ba rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to those with the callousness of ill will or those with much hatred.

original: le lo can rnams dang / brtson 'grus chung zhing brtson 'grus btang ba rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: le lo can rnams dang / brtson 'grus chung zhing brtson 'grus btang ba rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to the lazy or those with little diligence or those who have given up on diligence.

original: g-yeng zhing phyin ci log tu gyur la rnam par 'phro ba'i sems la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: g-yeng zhing phyin ci log tu gyur la rnam par 'phro ba'i sems la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to those with distracted, mistaken, or scattered minds.

original: shes rab 'chal ba rnams dang / blun pa lkugs pa'i rang bzhin can rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba rnams dang / blun pa lkugs pa'i rang bzhin can rnams la chags pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not attached to those with faulty wisdom or those with the nature of fools and idiots.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos dang / zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa rab tu sbyin pa la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos dang / zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa rab tu sbyin pa la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
translated: Bodhisattvas delight in giving the Dharma, material goods, and fearlessness.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang dag par chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang dag par chad pa'o //
translated: They have completely cut through desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rnal 'byor pa /
translated: They are great yogis.

original: sgra bsnyungs pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sgra bsnyungs pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: They delight in silence.

original: tshig mi mang zhing dul ba'o //
analyzed: tshig mi mang zhing dul ba'o //
translated: They are disciplined and speak little.

original: zhi zhing nye bar zhi ba la dben pa dang / nags tshal thibs po dang / rtsva dang / shing dang / ldam ldum yod pa dang / sa khyon chung ngu dang / chu ngogs dang / ri khrod dang / phug sna tshogs dang / ri dang /
analyzed: zhi zhing nye bar zhi ba la dben pa dang / nags tshal thibs po dang / rtsva dang / shing dang / ldam ldum yod pa dang / sa khyon chung ngu dang / chu ngogs dang / ri khrod dang / phug sna tshogs dang / ri dang /
translated: They delight in the wilderness, in remote places, in forests, in thickets, in places with grass, trees, and bushes, in small spaces, on river banks, in mountain retreats, in various caves, on mountains,

original: rdo dang / rtse mo dang / g-ye'i phyogs rnams la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: rdo dang / rtse mo dang / g-ye'i phyogs rnams la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
translated: on rocks, on peaks, and in valleys.

original: zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i phyogs de dag la rab tu dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i phyogs de dag la rab tu dga' ba yin te /
translated: They delight in those places that are peaceful, very peaceful, and completely peaceful.

original: gnas bcas pa'i phyogs de dang / de dag tu nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson par gnas pa dang / thos pa dang / @96a *//🔽sems pa dang / sgom pa stug po'i mthong na gnas pa dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / dbang dang / bzod pa'i sgo brgya stong la rnam par rgyu ba dang / chos kyi sgo brgya stong dpag tu med pa dag rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: gnas bcas pa'i phyogs de dang / de dag tu nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson par gnas pa dang / thos pa dang / @96a *// sems pa dang / sgom pa stug po'i mthong na gnas pa dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / dbang dang / bzod pa'i sgo brgya stong la rnam par rgyu ba dang / chos kyi sgo brgya stong dpag tu med pa dag rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang /
translated: They are the places where, during the first and last periods of the night, they remain diligent in yoga, not sleeping, and where they remain in the dense forest of listening,🔽contemplating, and meditating, and where they move through the hundreds of thousands of doors of concentration, absorption, dhāraṇī, power, and acceptance, and where they discern the hundreds of thousands of immeasurable Dharma doors.🔽

original: sangs rgyas brgya stong yang mthong ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo brgya stong yang thob pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo brgya stong yang mngon du byed pa dang / sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yang yongs su smin par byed pa de lta bu de dag la mngon par dga' ba yin te /🔽rigs kyi bu /

original: byang chub sems dpas de 'dra bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de 'dra bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should act in this way.

original: de lta bus ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid khong du chud par nus so //
analyzed: de lta bus ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid khong du chud par nus so //
translated: By this, one is able to understand the reality of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtsom pa med kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtsom pa med kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Asaṃpramoṣa said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: theg pa chen po ni bag mchis par gnas shing sgrub pa snying por bgyid pa rnams kyi lags so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni bag mchis par gnas shing sgrub pa snying por bgyid pa rnams kyi lags so //
translated: The Mahāyāna is for those who abide in heedfulness and make practice their essence.

original: de la sgrub pa ni byang chub tu smon pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni byang chub tu smon pa'o //
translated: Here, practice is the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: bag mchis pa ni smon lam yongs su skong ba'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni smon lam yongs su skong ba'o //
translated: Heedfulness is fulfilling one's aspirations.

original: gzhan yang sgrub pa ni sbyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrub pa ni sbyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Moreover, practice is applying oneself to generosity.

original: bag mchis pa ni rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'o //🔽sgrub pa ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'o // sgrub pa ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa ma nyams pa'o //
translated: Heedfulness is not hoping for karmic recompense.🔽Practice is the unbroken observance of the discipline of morality.

original: bag mchis pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul khrims bsgrub @96b pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul khrims bsgrub @96b pa'o //
translated: Heedfulness is accomplishing the irreversible morality.

original: sgrub pa na bzod pa rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa na bzod pa rtsom pa'o //
translated: Practice is the beginning of patience.

original: bag mchis pa ni mi skye ba'i chos rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni mi skye ba'i chos rtogs pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the realization of the unborn nature of phenomena.

original: sgrub pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kun tu tshol bas yongs su mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kun tu tshol bas yongs su mi skye ba'o //
translated: Practice is the non-production of all roots of virtue through seeking.

original: bag mchis pa ni rtsom pa thams cad yongs su 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni rtsom pa thams cad yongs su 'dor ba'o //
translated: Carefulness is the abandonment of all undertakings.

original: sgrub pa ni bsam gtan rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni bsam gtan rtsom pa'o //
translated: Practice is the undertaking of meditation.

original: bag mchis pa ni mi gnas pa'i bsam gtan pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni mi gnas pa'i bsam gtan pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the meditation that does not abide.

original: sgrub pa ni shes rab yongs su skong ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni shes rab yongs su skong ba'o //
translated: Practice is the fulfillment of wisdom.

original: bag mchis pa ni chos thams cad sprod par mi bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni chos thams cad sprod par mi bgyid pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the non-grasping of any phenomena.

original: sgrub pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Practice is the upholding of the sublime Dharma.

original: bag mchis pa ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the non-apprehension of any phenomena.

original: sgrub pa ni sems can rnams byang chub la rab tu 'god pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni sems can rnams byang chub la rab tu 'god pa'o //
translated: Practice is the establishment of all beings in enlightenment.

original: bag mchis pa ni sems can rnams mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni sems can rnams mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the non-apprehension of any beings.

original: sgrub pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bgyis nas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bgyis nas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: Practice is the dedication of all roots of virtue to enlightenment.

original: bag mchis pa ni chos thams cad byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni chos thams cad byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: Attentiveness is the realization that all phenomena are the essence of enlightenment.

original: sgrub pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is the attainment of acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: bag mchis pa ni bsam bzhin du srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni bsam bzhin du srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Attentiveness is the deliberate taking up of existence.

original: sgrub pa ni byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba'i bkod pa kun ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba'i bkod pa kun ston pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is the display of all the preparations for going to the site of enlightenment.

original: bag mchis pa ni bskal pa dpag tu ma mchis grangs ma mchis pa na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni bskal pa dpag tu ma mchis grangs ma mchis pa na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
translated: Attentiveness is the attainment of complete buddhahood after incalculable, innumerable eons.

original: sgrub pa ni byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Accomplishment is the attainment of enlightenment.

original: bag mchis pa ni sngar bgyi ba bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa ni sngar bgyi ba bgyis pa'o //
translated: Attentiveness is the performance of what is to be done beforehand.

original: sgrub pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen por nye bar mchi ba'o //🔽bag mchis @97a *//
analyzed: sgrub pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen por nye bar mchi ba'o // bag mchis @97a *//
translated: Accomplishment is the approach to great parinirvāṇa.

original: pa ni chos shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'tshal ba ste /
analyzed: pa ni chos shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'tshal ba ste /
translated: Attentiveness is the knowledge of the complete parinirvāṇa of phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sgrub pa 'di lta bu dang / bag mchis pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ni byang chub rnyed par dka' ba ma lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sgrub pa 'di lta bu dang / bag mchis pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ni byang chub rnyed par dka' ba ma lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, bodhisattvas who practice like this and are heedful like this will not find awakening difficult to attain.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas sgrub pa 'di dang / bag mchis pa 'di la brtson par bgyi ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas sgrub pa 'di dang / bag mchis pa 'di la brtson par bgyi ste /
translated: therefore bodhisattvas should apply themselves to this practice and this heedfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa lags so //
translated: this is the correct expression of the Dharma.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros rnam par gnon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros rnam par gnon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva great being Superior Intellect said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos yang dag par 'dzin pa zhig la gnas nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yang dag par sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos yang dag par 'dzin pa zhig la gnas nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yang dag par sgrub ste /
translated: here bodhisattvas, while abiding in the correct apprehension of the Dharma, accomplish the awakening of the buddhas.

original: de la kha cig ni 'di snyam du gang sangs rgyas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di chos gang gi ming du sangs rgyas zhes btags snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni 'di snyam du gang sangs rgyas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di chos gang gi ming du sangs rgyas zhes btags snyam du sems te /
translated: Some think, ‘What is the name of the Dharma that is called “buddha”?

original: de dag de ltar rtog pa na gang 'di sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba'i chos de dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag de ltar rtog pa na gang 'di sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba'i chos de dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: When they think in this way, they do not see any dharma that is called ‘Buddha.’

original: de dag sangs rgyas ji lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad khong du chud do //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas ji lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad khong du chud do //
translated: They understand all dharmas in the same way as they understand the Buddha.

original: de dag de ltar yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas gang ci yid la bgyid pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas thob par bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: de dag de ltar yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas gang ci yid la bgyid pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas thob par bgyid pa lags so //
translated: Because they have this kind of understanding, whatever they think is the attainment of Buddhahood.

original: la la ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: la la ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Some think like this:

original: gang @97b chos zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: gang @97b chos zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni yul na mi gnas /
translated: ‘This dharma called “dharma” does not exist in a place,

original: phyogs na mi gnas te /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas te /
translated: nor does it exist in a direction.

original: gzhan du na chos rang gi sems la rag las pa ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na chos rang gi sems la rag las pa ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: Other than that, it is not nonexistent, since it is dependent on one’s own mind.🔽Therefore, I should hold my own mind very tightly,🔽I should subdue it very thoroughly,🔽I should tame it very thoroughly,

original: de bas na bdag gis rang gi sems shin tu bzung ba dang / shin tu mthar gtugs pa dang / shin tu thul ba dang / shin tu mnyam par brtsam pa dang / shin tu tshar gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis rang gi sems shin tu bzung ba dang / shin tu mthar gtugs pa dang / shin tu thul ba dang / shin tu mnyam par brtsam pa dang / shin tu tshar gcad par bya'o //
translated: I should concentrate it very thoroughly,🔽and I should destroy it very thoroughly.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems gang yin pa de la ni yon tan dang / nyes pa rnams yod kyi /
analyzed: sems gang yin pa de la ni yon tan dang / nyes pa rnams yod kyi /
translated: Whatever is mind has virtues and faults.

original: sems med pa la ni yon tan dang / nyes pa rnams med do snyam ste /
analyzed: sems med pa la ni yon tan dang / nyes pa rnams med do snyam ste /
translated: But what is not mind has neither virtues nor faults.

original: de lta byang chub sems dpa' nyes pa rnams las sems bzlog nas yon tan rnams la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de lta byang chub sems dpa' nyes pa rnams las sems bzlog nas yon tan rnams la 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, having turned the mind away from faults, engages in virtues.

original: de bas na chos ni sems la rag las byang chub ni chos la rag las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos ni sems la rag las byang chub ni chos la rag las zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the Dharma depends on the mind and awakening depends on the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di chos yang dag par 'dzin pa lags te /
analyzed: 'di chos yang dag par 'dzin pa lags te /
translated: this is the correct understanding of the Dharma.

original: bde bar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur /
analyzed: bde bar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur /
translated: One will fully awaken to happiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig gi yang dag par 'dzin pa ni 'di lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig gi yang dag par 'dzin pa ni 'di lags so //
translated: this is the correct understanding of some bodhisattvas.

original: gang sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar mtshungs par 'jug pa'i sems de ni sems te /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar mtshungs par 'jug pa'i sems de ni sems te /
translated: That mind which engages equally in the welfare and happiness of all beings is the mind.

original: gang sems 'di 'dra ba dang mi ldan pa de ni sems can rnams la log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems 'di 'dra ba dang mi ldan pa de ni sems can rnams la log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who does not have such a mind is engaged in the wrong way with regard to beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can gyi zhing ni byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo //🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnyed @98a *//
analyzed: sems can gyi zhing ni byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo // sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnyed @98a *//
translated: The field of sentient beings is the Buddha field of the bodhisattva.🔽It is not right to enter into a Buddha field from which the qualities of a Buddha are not obtained and attained.

original: cing thob par 'gyur ba de la log par 'jug par bya ba'i mi rigs so snyam mo //🔽de'ang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: cing thob par 'gyur ba de la log par 'jug par bya ba'i mi rigs so snyam mo // de'ang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks, ‘I should enter into a Buddha field from which the qualities of a Buddha are obtained and attained.’

original: legs par spyod pa dang / nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyang sems la brten nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: legs par spyod pa dang / nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyang sems la brten nas 'byung ste /
translated: He thinks, ‘All good and bad actions arise in dependence on the mind.

original: nyes par spyod pa la gnas pa ni ngan song du skye'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la gnas pa ni ngan song du skye'o //
translated: Those who are engaged in bad actions are born in the lower realms.

original: legs par spyod pa la gnas pa ni lha dang / mir skye'o //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa la gnas pa ni lha dang / mir skye'o //
translated: Those who are engaged in good actions are born as gods and humans.

original: de gnyis ka yongs su spangs pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yang dag par 'dzin pa lags te /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yongs su spangs pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yang dag par 'dzin pa lags te /
translated: Those who have completely abandoned both are the Blessed Buddhas.’ This is the bodhisattvas’ correct adoption of Dharma,

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: which quickly leads to full and complete Awakening.”

original: kha cig ni chos yang dag par 'dzin pa ni 'di lta bu lags te /
analyzed: kha cig ni chos yang dag par 'dzin pa ni 'di lta bu lags te /
translated: Some of them thought, “This is the correct way to uphold the Dharma:

original: 'di dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba tsam du zad de /
translated: All of this is merely dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba'i chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba'i chos gang yang med do //
translated: There is no phenomenon that is free from dependent origination.

original: gang rten nas 'byung ba'i chos de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang rten nas 'byung ba'i chos de gang zhe na /
translated: What is a phenomenon that arises dependently?

original: gang rten te byung ba ni ma skyes pa ste ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i chos de gang yang med de /
analyzed: gang rten te byung ba ni ma skyes pa ste ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i chos de gang yang med de /
translated: That which arises dependently is unborn. There is no phenomenon that is essentially established.

original: gzhan du na bstan pa tsam dang / tha snyad tsam dang / btags pa tsam dang / brda tsam dang / don dam pa mngon par byed pa tsam ni med pa ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: gzhan du na bstan pa tsam dang / tha snyad tsam dang / btags pa tsam dang / brda tsam dang / don dam pa mngon par byed pa tsam ni med pa ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: Otherwise, it is not the case that there is no mere teaching, mere convention, mere designation, mere symbol, and mere performance of the ultimate.”

original: 'di ni ston pa po'i chos yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa po'i chos yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: This is the correct way to uphold the Dharma of the teacher.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa'i snying po lags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa'i snying po lags so //
translated: It is the essence of the teaching of all the buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽some bodhisattvas think,

original: byang @98b chub sems dpa' kha cig ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang @98b chub sems dpa' kha cig ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Some bodhisattvas think,🔽

original: skye ba zhes bya ba 'di chos gang gi ming du skye ba zhes bya snyam nas des gang 'di skye ba zhes bgyi ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba 'di chos gang gi ming du skye ba zhes bya snyam nas des gang 'di skye ba zhes bgyi ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: What is the name of the phenomenon called ‘arising’? He does not see any phenomenon called ‘arising.’

original: de 'di snyam du sems pa dang ldan pas chos thams cad ni ma skyes so snyam du bzod pa skyes so //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems pa dang ldan pas chos thams cad ni ma skyes so snyam du bzod pa skyes so //
translated: He thinks, ‘All phenomena are non-arisen.’

original: kha cig ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Some think,

original: gang 'chi ba zhes bya ba 'di 'dir chos ci zhig 'gags /
analyzed: gang 'chi ba zhes bya ba 'di 'dir chos ci zhig 'gags /
translated: ‘What is the phenomenon here that is called “death”?

original: gang 'gags pas 'chi ba zhes bya snyam ste /
analyzed: gang 'gags pas 'chi ba zhes bya snyam ste /
translated: What ceases to be called “death”?

original: de de ltar so sor rtog pa na gang 'gags pas 'chi ba zhes bgyi ba'i chos de dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de de ltar so sor rtog pa na gang 'gags pas 'chi ba zhes bgyi ba'i chos de dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: When he investigates in this way, he does not see any phenomenon that ceases to be called “death.”

original: 'di ni chos yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni chos yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: This is the correct apprehension of phenomena.

original: bdud rtsi khong du chud par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi khong du chud par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the attainment of immortality.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs ni chos thams cad la mi chags pa lags te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs ni chos thams cad la mi chags pa lags te /
translated: the minds of the blessed buddhas are unattached to any phenomenon.

original: de dag ni yid dang / gnas pa ma mchis pa rnams kyis mnyes par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de dag ni yid dang / gnas pa ma mchis pa rnams kyis mnyes par bgyi'o //
translated: They are to be pleased by those who are without mental activity and without dwelling.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos ni sgrib pa ma mchis lags te /
analyzed: chos ni sgrib pa ma mchis lags te /
translated: the Dharma is without obscuration.

original: de ni sems sgrib pa ma mchis pa rnams kyis 'thob bo //
analyzed: de ni sems sgrib pa ma mchis pa rnams kyis 'thob bo //
translated: It is attained by those whose minds are without obscuration.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos mnyam pa ni byang chub lags te /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa ni byang chub lags te /
translated: awakening is the sameness of the Dharma.

original: de ni sems mi mnyam pa ma mchis pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems mi mnyam pa ma mchis pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is realized by those whose minds are without any sense of sameness or difference.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji tsam du tshol ba de tsam du 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du tshol ba de tsam du 'ching ba'o //
translated: to the extent that there is searching, to that extent there is bondage.

original: mi tshol ba ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: mi tshol ba ni thar pa'o //
translated: Not searching is liberation.

original: de bas na thar pa tshol ba thams cad mi btsal bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: de bas na thar pa tshol ba thams cad mi btsal bar bgyi ste /
translated: Therefore, all those who search for liberation should not search.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di ni chos yang @99a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / 'di ni chos yang @99a *//
translated: Blessed One,

original: dag par brjod pa lags so //
analyzed: dag par brjod pa lags so //
translated: this is the correct expression of the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang / chos yang dag par brjod ba zhes bgyi pa 'di ni mnyam pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos yang dag par brjod ba zhes bgyi pa 'di ni mnyam pa'i tshig go /
translated: furthermore, this so-called correct expression of the Dharma is a word for sameness,

original: 'di ni zab pa'i tshig go /🔽'di ni len pa ma mchis pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: 'di ni zab pa'i tshig go / 'di ni len pa ma mchis pa'i tshig go /
translated: a word for the profound,🔽a word for the unconditioned,

original: 'di ni gzhi ma mchis pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi ma mchis pa'i tshig go /
translated: a word for the groundless,

original: 'di ni kun gzhi ma mchis pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: 'di ni kun gzhi ma mchis pa'i tshig go /
translated: This is the word for the non-existence of the store-consciousness.

original: 'di ni rten ma mchis pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: 'di ni rten ma mchis pa'i tshig go /
translated: This is the word for the non-existence of a basis.

original: 'di ni de lo na dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de lo na dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi tshig ste /
translated: This is the word for the reality-limit, for thusness, and for unaltered thusness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa lags so //
translated: this is the correct expression for phenomena.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la che dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag gis bshad pa rnams thos sam /
translated: according to my understanding of the meaning of what the Blessed One has said, those bodhisattva great beings who hear these explanations of the Tathāgata and the bodhisattva great beings,

analyzed: thos nas kyang dad cing de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa de dag la chos yang dag par brjod pa ma mchis snyam bgyid do //
translated: and having heard them, have faith and practice in accordance with them, they do not have the correct expression for phenomena.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi mos pa mang ba la ni chos yang dag par brjod pa ma mchis /
analyzed: mi mos pa mang ba la ni chos yang dag par brjod pa ma mchis /
translated: Those who have little interest in the Dharma do not expound the Dharma.

original: bgyi ba ma brtsams pa la ni chos yang dag par brjod pa ma mchis kyi /
analyzed: bgyi ba ma brtsams pa la ni chos yang dag par brjod pa ma mchis kyi /
translated: Those who have not begun to practice do not expound the Dharma.

analyzed: gang 'phags pas bshad pa'i chos rnams la dkon par 'du shes pa dang / rin po cher 'du shes pa dang @99b sman du 'du shes pa de dag la ni chos yang dag par brjod pa mchis /
translated: Those who have the perception of the Dharma taught by the noble ones as being rare, as being precious, and as being medicine expound the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang bdag la mi bstod pa dang / gzhan la mi smod pa de dag la chos yang dag par brjod pa mchis bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gang bdag la mi bstod pa dang / gzhan la mi smod pa de dag la chos yang dag par brjod pa mchis bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: gang bdag rgya cher yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / gang mnyam pa rnams la'ang mnyam /

analyzed: mi mnyam pa rnams la'ang mnyam / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa rnams la'ang mnyam zhing /

analyzed: mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam par yang mi rtog pa de dag la chos yang dag  par brjod pa mchis /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: gang tshig gcig thos pas tshig brgya stong gi don dang / le'u la 'jug cing khong du chud de /

analyzed: don dang / gzhung la gnyis su 'du shes mi 'gyur ba de dag la chos yang dag par brjod pa mchis /

analyzed: g-yeng bar yang mi 'gyur ba dang / gang chos thos nas 'ching bar yang mi 'gyur /

analyzed: thar par yang mi 'gyur ba dang / gang chos thos nas 'jug par yang mi 'gyur /

analyzed: khro bar yang mi 'gyur ba dang / gang chos thos nas 'khor bar yang mi 'gyur /

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par yang mi 'gyur ba dang / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: gang chos yang dag par brjod pas chos nyid 'di rjes su rtogs pa de dag la chos yang dag par brjod pa mchis snyam bgyid na /

analyzed: bdag mchi ba lta bu chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun pa lta lags sam /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: khyod kyi 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun pa yin no //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: gnyis kar sgro btags nas ma lags /
analyzed: gnyis kar sgro btags nas ma lags /

original: bag la nyal du btags nas ma lags so //
analyzed: bag la nyal du btags nas ma lags so //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: sgro btags pa thams cad ni ma mchis pa las sgro btags pa'i slad du'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: chos gang sgro btags pa de ni rjes su ma mchis pa lags so //

translated: For bodhisattva great beings who understand superimpositions, whatever is a superimposition is a phenomenon.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sgro btags pa sgro btags pa zhes bgyi ba /
analyzed: sgro btags pa sgro btags pa zhes bgyi ba /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ji tsam gyis na sgro btags pa zhes bgyi zhe na /

analyzed: gang chos yang dag par brjod pa dang / gang chos yang dag par rjod pa po dang / gang dag la chos yang dag par brjod pa de dag thams cad ni /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid du mtshan nyid gcig go /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bdag gi chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun pa lta lags sam /

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: thar pa'ang kun tu mi tshol te /
