translated: when it is said that ‘the Dharma is the Dharma,’ this is a term that refers to soundlessness.

original: gang sgra mi 'byin pa ni de'i chos so //
analyzed: gang sgra mi 'byin pa ni de'i chos so //
translated: That which does not produce sound is the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de la mig gis gzugs rnams la sgra mi 'byin /
analyzed: de la mig gis gzugs rnams la sgra mi 'byin /
translated: The eyes do not make a sound with regard to forms.

original: rna bas sgra rnams dang / snas dri rnams dang / lces ro rnams dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis chos rnams la sgra mi 'byin pa de ni chos so //
analyzed: rna bas sgra rnams dang / snas dri rnams dang / lces ro rnams dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis chos rnams la sgra mi 'byin pa de ni chos so //
translated: The ears do not make a sound with regard to sounds, the nose with regard to smells, the tongue with regard to tastes, the body with regard to touchables, and the thinking-mind with regard to thoughts.

original: de la ji ltar na mig gis gzugs rnams la sgra mi 'byin ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na mig gis gzugs rnams la sgra mi 'byin ce na /
translated: In what way do the eyes not make a sound with regard to forms?

original: phrad pa ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: phrad pa ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: It is because they do not make contact.

original: mig ni gzugs la phrad par mi bgyid /
analyzed: mig ni gzugs la phrad par mi bgyid /
translated: The eyes do not make contact with forms.

original: rna bas sgra la ma lags /🔽snas dri la ma lags /
analyzed: rna bas sgra la ma lags / snas dri la ma lags /
translated: The ears do not make contact with sounds.🔽The nose does not make contact with smells.

original: lces ro la ma lags /
analyzed: lces ro la ma lags /
translated: The tongue does not make contact with tastes.

original: lus kyis reg bya la ma lags /
analyzed: lus kyis reg bya la ma lags /
translated: The body does not make contact with touchables.

original: yid kyis chos la phrad par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: yid kyis chos la phrad par mi bgyid do //
translated: The thinking-mind does not make contact with thoughts.

original: gang phrad par mi bgyid pa de ni sgra mi 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: gang phrad par mi bgyid pa de ni sgra mi 'byin pa'o //
translated: That which does not make contact does not make a sound.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gnyis su ma mchis na chos la sgra 'byin pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: gnyis su ma mchis na chos la sgra 'byin pa ma mchis so //
translated: if there is no duality, there is no sound in phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad ni gnyis su ma mchis pa ste /🔽gcig gis gcig ma 'tshal /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnyis su ma mchis pa ste / gcig gis gcig ma 'tshal /
translated: all phenomena are nondual.🔽One does not know the other.

original: rnam par ma 'tshal /
analyzed: rnam par ma 'tshal /
translated: One does not understand the other.

original: mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog /🔽'byung bar mi bgyid /
analyzed: mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog / 'byung bar mi bgyid /
translated: It is non-conceptual and non-discriminatory.

original: 'jig par mi @105b bgyid /🔽'dri bar mi bgyid /🔽'phel bar mi bgyid /🔽chags par mi bgyid /🔽mi chags par mi bgyid /
analyzed: 'jig par mi @105b bgyid / 'dri bar mi bgyid / 'phel bar mi bgyid / chags par mi bgyid / mi chags par mi bgyid /
translated: It does not create or destroy.🔽It does not diminish or increase.

original: 'khor bar mi bgyid /
analyzed: 'khor bar mi bgyid /
translated: It does not cause attachment or non-attachment.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi bgyid de /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi bgyid de /
translated: It does not cause one to enter saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.

original: 'di dag ni su'i yang ma lags /
analyzed: 'di dag ni su'i yang ma lags /
translated: It does not belong to anyone.

original: 'di dag ni ci'ang ma lags so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ci'ang ma lags so //
translated: It is nothing at all.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos 'di dag ni skyo bar yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni skyo bar yang mi bgyid /
translated: these phenomena do not cause weariness

original: chags par yang mi bgyid de /
analyzed: chags par yang mi bgyid de /
translated: or attachment.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽chos 'di dag ni kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / chos 'di dag ni kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: these phenomena are neither defiled nor purified.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis de ltar 'tshal to //
analyzed: bdag gis de ltar 'tshal to //
translated: I understand this thus.

original: bdag gis de ltar rtogs so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bdag gis de ltar rtogs so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: I realize this thus. Blessed One,

original: gang bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal /
analyzed: gang bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal /
translated: to say 'I understand this thus'

original: 'di ltar rtogs so zhes de skad mchi ba 'di ni skye mched rnams kyi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs so zhes de skad mchi ba 'di ni skye mched rnams kyi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: or 'I realize this thus' is a transformation of the sense sources.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: skye ma ched rnams ni 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag cag gi 'gyur ba'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: skye ma ched rnams ni 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag cag gi 'gyur ba'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The unborn do not think, ‘This is our transformation.’

original: gang de ltar 'tshal ba de ni su dang yang mi rtsod do //
analyzed: gang de ltar 'tshal ba de ni su dang yang mi rtsod do //
translated: Those who understand in this way do not dispute with anyone.

original: gang mi rtsod pa de ni dge slong gi chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //🔽gang dge sbyong gi chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa de ni gang nas kyang 'jug par yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: gang mi rtsod pa de ni dge slong gi chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa'o // gang dge sbyong gi chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa de ni gang nas kyang 'jug par yang mi bgyid /
translated: Those who do not dispute are following the Dharma of the monks.🔽Those who follow the Dharma of the mendicants do not engage with anything.

original: mi 'jug par yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: mi 'jug par yang mi bgyid /
translated: They do not disengage with anything.

original: sbyor bar yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: sbyor bar yang mi bgyid /
translated: They do not apply themselves.🔽They do not not apply themselves.

original: mi sbyor bar yang mi bgyid; 'gro bar yang mi bgyid /🔽sdig par yang mi bgyid /🔽'bri bar yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: mi sbyor bar yang mi bgyid; 'gro bar yang mi bgyid / sdig par yang mi bgyid / 'bri bar yang mi bgyid /
translated: They do not go.🔽They do not come.🔽They do not decrease.

original: 'phel bar yang mi bgyid de /🔽thams cad chos kyi tshul mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'phel bar yang mi bgyid de / thams cad chos kyi tshul mthong ngo //
translated: They do not increase.🔽They see the way of all phenomena.

original: thams cad rnam par @106a *//
analyzed: thams cad rnam par @106a *//
translated: They see all as

original: rig pa'i tshul du mthong ngo //
analyzed: rig pa'i tshul du mthong ngo //
translated: the way of cognition.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: They see the realm of phenomena.

original: de ltar thams cad 'byung bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad 'byung bar mthong ste /
translated: In this way, they see everything as arising.

original: gang 'byung ba de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzhan du na ming tsam dang / btags pa tsam dang / tha snyad tsam du mthong ba ni ma mchis pa ma lags so //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzhan du na ming tsam dang / btags pa tsam dang / tha snyad tsam du mthong ba ni ma mchis pa ma lags so //
translated: He does not see any arising, but he does see the mere name, the mere designation, the mere convention.

original: ming de'ang ming ma mchis pa'o //🔽btags pa'ang btags pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: ming de'ang ming ma mchis pa'o // btags pa'ang btags pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: That name is not a name.🔽That designation is not a designation.

original: tha snyad kyang tha snyad ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang tha snyad ma mchis pa'o //
translated: That convention is not a convention.

original: chos mthong bas sangs rgyas mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos mthong bas sangs rgyas mthong ngo //
translated: Seeing the Dharma is seeing the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas mthong bas sems can thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong bas sems can thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: Seeing the Buddha is seeing all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad mthong bas rgyu dang / rkyen mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mthong bas rgyu dang / rkyen mthong ngo //
translated: Seeing all sentient beings is seeing causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen mthong bas stong pa nyid mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen mthong bas stong pa nyid mthong ngo //
translated: Seeing causes and conditions is seeing emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid mthong ba ni mthong ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mthong ba ni mthong ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Seeing emptiness is non-seeing.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad ma mthong ba ni yang dag par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma mthong ba ni yang dag par mthong ba'o //
translated: not seeing any phenomena is seeing reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang de ltar mthong ba dang ldan pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par mi bgyid /
analyzed: gang de ltar mthong ba dang ldan pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par mi bgyid /
translated: Those who see in this way do not please the buddhas,🔽nor do they displease them.

original: mi mnyes par yang mi bgyid do; ;de chos mnyes par yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: mi mnyes par yang mi bgyid do; ;de chos mnyes par yang mi bgyid /
translated: They do not please the Dharma,

original: mi mnyes par yang mi bgyid do //
analyzed: mi mnyes par yang mi bgyid do //
translated: nor do they displease it.

original: de dge 'dun mnyes par yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: de dge 'dun mnyes par yang mi bgyid /
translated: They do not please the Saṅgha,

original: mi mnyes par yang mi bgyid do //
analyzed: mi mnyes par yang mi bgyid do //
translated: nor do they displease it.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bdud rnams dang yang mi rtsod na /
analyzed: bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bdud rnams dang yang mi rtsod na /
translated: bodhisattvas who have such patience do not even argue with māras,

original: chos mthun pa rnams dang mi rtsod pa lta smos kyang mi 'tshal te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa rnams dang mi rtsod pa lta smos kyang mi 'tshal te /
translated: let alone argue with those who are in accord with the Dharma.

original: de ni gnas ma lags @106b so; ;brjod pa thams cad bdag gi phyogs su 'grub par mthong bas gang dang yang rtsod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma lags @106b so; ;brjod pa thams cad bdag gi phyogs su 'grub par mthong bas gang dang yang rtsod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is impossible that they would argue with anyone, because they see all statements as being established in their own position.

original: rtsod pa ma mchis pas su dang yang lhan cig sgra 'byin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa ma mchis pas su dang yang lhan cig sgra 'byin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they do not argue, they do not speak with anyone.

original: sgra ma mchis pa'i chos dang ldan pa ni chos thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ma mchis pa'i chos dang ldan pa ni chos thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who possess the Dharma of soundlessness possess all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bgyi ba ni chos thams cad bdag bzhin du gyur pa /🔽mnyam par gnas pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bgyi ba ni chos thams cad bdag bzhin du gyur pa / mnyam par gnas pa /
translated: “Endowed with all dharmas” means that all dharmas are like the self.🔽They are the same.

original: mnyam par bzod pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par bzod pa ste /
translated: They are the same in their acceptance.

original: de bas na chos thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bgyi'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be “endowed with all dharmas.”

original: gang du'ang mi mchi /
analyzed: gang du'ang mi mchi /
translated: They do not go anywhere.

original: gang nas kyang ma mchis pas de'i slad du ldan pa zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang nas kyang ma mchis pas de'i slad du ldan pa zhes bgyi'o //
translated: They do not come from anywhere. Therefore, they are said to be “endowed.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gang cung zad smra ba dang / kun smra ba de thams cad ni chos yang dag pa dag brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gang cung zad smra ba dang / kun smra ba de thams cad ni chos yang dag pa dag brjod pa ste /
translated: in that way, whatever a bodhisattva endowed with all dharmas says or speaks is the expression of the true Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa thob par bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa thob par bgyid pa'o //
translated: It brings benefit to all beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag mchi ba 'di lta bu chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun pa lta lags sam /
analyzed: bdag mchi ba 'di lta bu chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun pa lta lags sam /
translated: is this kind of going of mine in accord with the expression of the true Dharma?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / khyod kyi 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod kyi 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun no //
translated: “Subhūti, this is in accord with the expression of the true Dharma.”

original: rab 'byor gyis chos yang dag par brjod pa 'di brjod pa na dge slong lnga stong ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul dang bral zhing dri ma med pa rnam par dag go /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis chos yang dag par brjod pa 'di brjod pa na dge slong lnga stong ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul dang bral zhing dri ma med pa rnam par dag go /
translated: When Subhūti had spoken this Dharma discourse, five thousand monks were freed from their mental disturbances with regard to phenomena, and their minds were liberated from the contaminations.

original: lha'i bu lnga stong ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: lha'i bu lnga stong ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: Five thousand gods gave rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: gang khyod kyi chos yang dag par brjod pa 'di thos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @107a *//
analyzed: gang khyod kyi chos yang dag par brjod pa 'di thos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @107a *//
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattvas who hear this Dharma discourse of yours

original: de dag ni chos kyi rgya mtsho thob bo snyam du bdag nyid kyis shes so //
analyzed: de dag ni chos kyi rgya mtsho thob bo snyam du bdag nyid kyis shes so //
translated: will think, ‘They have attained the ocean of the Dharma.’

original: don yod cing 'bras bu dang bcas par bdag nyid kyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: don yod cing 'bras bu dang bcas par bdag nyid kyis mthong ngo //
translated: They will see that it is meaningful and has results.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos yang dag par brjod pa dam pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos yang dag par brjod pa dam pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, this is the highest Dharma discourse of all the thus-gone ones.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Aniruddha said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad yi ger yang dag par brjod pa ni chos yang dag par brjod pa lags so //
analyzed: chos thams cad yi ger yang dag par brjod pa ni chos yang dag par brjod pa lags so //
translated: The correct expression of all phenomena is the correct expression of phenomena.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yi ge ni mi 'gyur bas de'i slad du yi ge zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: yi ge ni mi 'gyur bas de'i slad du yi ge zhes bgyi'o //
translated: Because the syllables are unchanging, they are called syllables.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang brjod pa de ni yi ge tsam du bas te /
analyzed: gang brjod pa de ni yi ge tsam du bas te /
translated: what is expressed is merely syllables.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: yi ge'i 'bru de dag ni khong nas kyang sgra mi 'byin /
analyzed: yi ge'i 'bru de dag ni khong nas kyang sgra mi 'byin /
translated: those syllables do not produce a sound from within,

original: slad rol nas kyang sgra mi 'byin te /
analyzed: slad rol nas kyang sgra mi 'byin te /
translated: nor do they produce a sound from without.

original: sgra 'byin pa de dag kyang 'di ltar bdag cag ni sgra 'byin to snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sgra 'byin pa de dag kyang 'di ltar bdag cag ni sgra 'byin to snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Those who produce sounds do not think, ‘We are producing sounds.’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: yi ge'i 'bru rnams mi zad par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yi ge'i 'bru rnams mi zad par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: the syllables do not become inexhaustible,

original: 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor do they increase.

original: byang chub sems dpas yi ge mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas yi ge mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par bgyi'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas should understand all phenomena to be the same through the sameness of syllables.

original: de ltar chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sgra thams cad la khong khro ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sgra thams cad la khong khro ba ma mchis te /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva who has understood the sameness of all phenomena has no anger towards any sound.

original: gzhan du na sgra thams cad chos kyi sgrar thos pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi sgra dang / mtshan ma med pa'i sgra dang / smon pa @107b med pa'i sgra dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sgra dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i sgrar thos so //
analyzed: gzhan du na sgra thams cad chos kyi sgrar thos pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi sgra dang / mtshan ma med pa'i sgra dang / smon pa @107b med pa'i sgra dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sgra dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i sgrar thos so //
translated: Otherwise, he hears all sounds as the sound of Dharma, as the sound of emptiness, as the sound of signlessness, as the sound of wishlessness, as the sound of the dharma-element, and as the sound of the very limit of reality.

original: de'i chos gang yang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par 'gyur ba dang 'gal ba ma lags so //
analyzed: de'i chos gang yang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par 'gyur ba dang 'gal ba ma lags so //
translated: There is no dharma of his that is incompatible with the realization of omniscience.

original: de chos gang yang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang 'gal bar mi mthong gi /
analyzed: de chos gang yang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang 'gal bar mi mthong gi /
translated: He does not see any dharma that is incompatible with the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: de chos thams cad sgrib pa ma mchis par mthong /
analyzed: de chos thams cad sgrib pa ma mchis par mthong /
translated: He sees all dharmas as unobstructed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang skal pa mnyam pa dang / mi 'gal bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang skal pa mnyam pa dang / mi 'gal bar mthong ngo //
translated: He sees them as not incompatible with the enlightenment of the buddhas, as being of the same fortune as the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: de gang las ldog pa dang / gang du 'jug pa'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de gang las ldog pa dang / gang du 'jug pa'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the Dharma from which he turns away, nor that into which he enters.

original: de sems can de dag kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
analyzed: de sems can de dag kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
translated: He does not see those sentient beings whom he would liberate.

original: sems can gyi don bgyi ba la mi phyogs pa'ang ma lags so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bgyi ba la mi phyogs pa'ang ma lags so //
translated: But he is not averse to working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni spobs pa zab mo 'thob ste /
analyzed: bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni spobs pa zab mo 'thob ste /
translated: a bodhisattva great being who has such patience attains profound eloquence.

original: spobs pa zab mo gang zhe na /
analyzed: spobs pa zab mo gang zhe na /
translated: What is profound eloquence?

translated: He relies on the bodhisattva vows.

original: cho ga dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa'ang lags la /
analyzed: cho ga dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa'ang lags la /
translated: He is perfect in conduct and sphere of activity,

original: cho ga dang / spyod yul tsam gyis dag par yang mi sems te /
analyzed: cho ga dang / spyod yul tsam gyis dag par yang mi sems te /
translated: but does not consider that purity comes from conduct and sphere of activity alone.

original: byang chub sems @110b dpa'i cho ga dang / spyod yul la rton pa yang lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems @110b dpa'i cho ga dang / spyod yul la rton pa yang lags so //
translated: He relies on the bodhisattva’s conduct and sphere of activity.

original: kha na ma tho ba rab tu phra ba dag la 'jig par lta ba'ang lags la /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba rab tu phra ba dag la 'jig par lta ba'ang lags la /
translated: He sees danger in the slightest fault,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes la rton pa'ang lags so; ;de la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes la rton pa'ang lags so; ;de la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad kyi de kho na 'tshal bas las dang / nyon mongs pas 'jigs shing skrag pa ma mchis pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i de kho na 'tshal ba lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad kyi de kho na 'tshal bas las dang / nyon mongs pas 'jigs shing skrag pa ma mchis pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i de kho na 'tshal ba lags so //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ wisdom is the knowledge of the reality of all phenomena.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s domain?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid spyod yul ba rnams lags te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid spyod yul ba rnams lags te /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ domain is emptiness.

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa spyod yul ba ma lags so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa spyod yul ba ma lags so //
translated: It is not the domain of conceptualization, discursive thought, and imagination.

original: yang dag par blangs nas bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob ste; stong pa nyid du mnyam pa nyid yang dag par blangs nas slob pa 'di ni yang dag par blangs nas slob ma zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs nas bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob ste; stong pa nyid du mnyam pa nyid yang dag par blangs nas slob pa 'di ni yang dag par blangs nas slob ma zhes bgyi'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas train in the bases of training by taking up the practice of the sameness of emptiness. This is called ‘training by taking up the practice.’

original: mtshan ma ma mchis par mnyam pa nyid dang / smon pa ma mchis par mnyam pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du mi bgyid par mnyam pa nyid dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung bar mnyam pa nyid yang dag par blangs nas slob pa 'di ni yang dag par blangs nas bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob pa zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis par mnyam pa nyid dang / smon pa ma mchis par mnyam pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du mi bgyid par mnyam pa nyid dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung bar mnyam pa nyid yang dag par blangs nas slob pa 'di ni yang dag par blangs nas bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob pa zhes bgyi'o //
translated: “Having taken up the sameness of signlessness, the sameness of wishlessness, the sameness of non-performance, the sameness of non-production, and the sameness of non-occurrence, he trains in the bases of training that have been taken up.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /🔽so sor thar @111a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te / so sor thar @111a *//
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva thinks,

original: pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims 'di la sems can rnams dgod par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa lags so //
analyzed: pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims 'di la sems can rnams dgod par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa lags so //
translated: ‘I will establish beings in the morality of the prātimokṣa vows.’ This is the bodhisattva’s higher training in morality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva’s higher training in mind?

original: gang rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams la slob pa lags so //
analyzed: gang rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams la slob pa lags so //
translated: It is training in the eight liberations.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva thinks,

original: bdag gis lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa 'di la sems can thams cad bsgrub par bgyi'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa lags so //
analyzed: bdag gis lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa 'di la sems can thams cad bsgrub par bgyi'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa lags so //
translated: “I must establish all sentient beings in this training of higher intention.” This is the bodhisattva’s training of higher intention.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva’s training of higher wisdom?”

original: gang stong pa nyid rnam pa bco brgyad la slob pa lags so //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid rnam pa bco brgyad la slob pa lags so //
translated: “It is the training in the eighteen kinds of emptiness.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva thinks,

original: stong pa nyid rnam pa bco brgyad 'di sems can thams cad kyi khong du chud par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa lags te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam pa bco brgyad 'di sems can thams cad kyi khong du chud par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa lags te /
translated: “I must help all sentient beings to understand these eighteen kinds of emptiness.” This is the bodhisattva’s training of higher wisdom.

original: bslab pa gsum po 'di dag tu byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad 'dus lags so //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po 'di dag tu byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad 'dus lags so //
translated: All the bodhisattva’s training is included in these three trainings.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' gang sems can rnams srung ba de ni tshul khrims srung ba lags so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' gang sems can rnams srung ba de ni tshul khrims srung ba lags so //
translated: a bodhisattva who protects sentient beings is protecting morality.

original: gang tshul khrims srung ba de ni tshul khrims ma snyems pa ste /
analyzed: gang tshul khrims srung ba de ni tshul khrims ma snyems pa ste /
translated: One who protects morality does not exalt morality.

original: de tshul khrims des sems @111b can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid do //
analyzed: de tshul khrims des sems @111b can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid do //
translated: By that morality, he fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni mngon par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni mngon par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: a bodhisattva has the character of renunciation.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad la mi chags so //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to any possessions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dben pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dben pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: A bodhisattva has the character of solitude.

original: 'du 'dzi thams cad la mi chags so //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi thams cad la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to any social interactions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: A bodhisattva has the character of inner serenity.

original: bya ba thams cad la mi chags so //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to any activities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam gtan gyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam gtan gyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: A bodhisattva has the character of meditative concentration.

original: yul thams cad la mi chags so //
analyzed: yul thams cad la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to any objects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par grol ba'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par grol ba'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of liberation.

original: skye ba'i skye mched thams cad la mi chags so //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye mched thams cad la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to any place of birth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos nyan pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos nyan pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of listening to the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gtam thams cad la mi chags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gtam thams cad la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to any worldly conversation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos ston pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos ston pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of teaching the Dharma.

original: dpag tshad brgyar yang song nas chos ston pas yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyar yang song nas chos ston pas yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
translated: He is not discouraged by having to go a hundred leagues to teach the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of upholding the holy Dharma.

original: sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i log par lta ba thams cad kyis yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i log par lta ba thams cad kyis yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
translated: He is not discouraged by all the suffering and mental dissatisfaction of wrong views.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of the thought of awakening.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir rtsol gyi /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir rtsol gyi /
translated: He strives for the benefit of all beings,

original: bdag la phan pa'i phyir ma lags so //
analyzed: bdag la phan pa'i phyir ma lags so //
translated: not for his own benefit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa'i ngang tshul can te /🔽thog ma kho nar sems can @112a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa'i ngang tshul can te / thog ma kho nar sems can @112a *//
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of intention.

original: rnams byang chub par 'tshal gyi bdag ni ma lags so //
analyzed: rnams byang chub par 'tshal gyi bdag ni ma lags so //
translated: First of all, he wishes for the enlightenment of all beings, not for himself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'i ngang tshul can te /🔽gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas rab tu nor dang ldan pa lags kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'i ngang tshul can te / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas rab tu nor dang ldan pa lags kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of superior intention.

original: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pas ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pas ni ma lags so //
translated: He is rich with the perfection of the aims of others, not with the perfection of his own aims.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyor ba'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyor ba'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of application.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi dge ba re re'i phyir yang bskal pa grangs ma mchis par yongs su sgrub par spro zhing yongs su mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi dge ba re re'i phyir yang bskal pa grangs ma mchis par yongs su sgrub par spro zhing yongs su mi skye ba'o //
translated: He is not discouraged by the necessity of accomplishing each of the dharmas that are factors of enlightenment for countless eons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of generosity.

original: yan lag gi dam pa mgo 'ang yongs su gtong zhing sems can gyi don yang bgyid do //
analyzed: yan lag gi dam pa mgo 'ang yongs su gtong zhing sems can gyi don yang bgyid do //
translated: He gives even his head, the noblest of limbs, and he accomplishes the aims of beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims kyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of morality;

original: sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: he does not abandon immoral beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bzod pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bzod pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of tolerance;

original: bdud thams cad kyis mi 'jigs so //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis mi 'jigs so //
translated: he is not frightened by any demon.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni brtson 'grus kyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni brtson 'grus kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of effort;

original: sems can thams cad la byang chub yang dag par sgrub pas yongs su mi skyo'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byang chub yang dag par sgrub pas yongs su mi skyo'o //
translated: he is not discouraged by the task of establishing all beings in enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam gtan gyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam gtan gyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of contemplation;

original: sgra thams cad dang / bya ba'i brtsam pa thams cad kyi mi 'khrugs so //
analyzed: sgra thams cad dang / bya ba'i brtsam pa thams cad kyi mi 'khrugs so //
translated: he is not disturbed by any sound or by any activity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni shes rab kyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni shes rab kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of wisdom;

original: chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang mtshungs @112b bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang mtshungs @112b bar mthong ngo //
translated: he sees all things as equal to the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattva is of the nature of emptiness;

original: 'khor ba la mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba la mi gnas so //
translated: he does not dwell in the life-cycle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje chen po'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje chen po'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are of the nature of great compassion.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not pass into complete nirvāṇa.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa lags pa snyam bgyid na /
analyzed: 'di ni chos yang dag par brjod pa lags pa snyam bgyid na /
translated: I think this is the correct expression of the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag chos yang dag par brjod par dang mthun par bgyid dam /
analyzed: bdag chos yang dag par brjod par dang mthun par bgyid dam /
translated: am I acting in accordance with the correct expression of the Dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sgra gcan zin /
analyzed: sgra gcan zin /
translated: Rāhula,

original: khyod kyi 'di chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'di chos yang dag par brjod pa dang mthun no //
translated: your expression of the Dharma is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa nye ba 'khor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa nye ba 'khor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Upāli said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang bdag dul ba de sems can gzhan 'dul ba'i slad du sems can gyi khams ji tsam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings ji tsam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi khams su btags pas btags pa ji tsam pa de srid kyi dus su sems can 'dul yang yongs su mi skyo'o; ;de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang bdag dul ba de sems can gzhan 'dul ba'i slad du sems can gyi khams ji tsam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings ji tsam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi khams su btags pas btags pa ji tsam pa de srid kyi dus su sems can 'dul yang yongs su mi skyo'o; ;de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks,

original: chos thams cad ni shin tu dul ba yin na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shin tu dul ba yin na /
translated: ‘All phenomena are completely disciplined,

original: de dag sems can rnams kyi khong du ma chud do snyam mo //
analyzed: de dag sems can rnams kyi khong du ma chud do snyam mo //
translated: but beings do not understand this.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyis dul ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyis dul ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are disciplined by emptiness.

original: de la lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang / brtson pa thams cad mi spyod do //
analyzed: de la lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang / brtson pa thams cad mi spyod do //
translated: In this, all views and all efforts are not engaged.

original: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma ma mchis pas dul ba ste /🔽de la rnam par rtog @113a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma ma mchis pas dul ba ste / de la rnam par rtog @113a *//
translated: All phenomena are disciplined by signlessness.

original: pa dang / dpyod pa mi spyod do //
analyzed: pa dang / dpyod pa mi spyod do //
translated: In this, all thoughts and all analyses are not engaged.

original: chos thams cad ni smon pa ma mchis pas dul ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni smon pa ma mchis pas dul ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are disciplined in the absence of wishes.

original: de la yid kyis smon pa dang / smon lam thams cad mi spyod do //
analyzed: de la yid kyis smon pa dang / smon lam thams cad mi spyod do //
translated: There is no mental wish or aspiration to be found there.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag ma mchis pas dul ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag ma mchis pas dul ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are disciplined in the absence of a self.

original: de la chags pa thams cad mi spyod do //
analyzed: de la chags pa thams cad mi spyod do //
translated: There is no attachment to be found there.

original: chos thams cad ni sems can ma mchis pas dul ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems can ma mchis pas dul ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are disciplined in the absence of sentient beings.

original: de la sems can tha dad pa mi spyod do //
analyzed: de la sems can tha dad pa mi spyod do //
translated: There are no different sentient beings to be found there.

original: chos thams cad ni srog ma mchis pas dul ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni srog ma mchis pas dul ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are disciplined in the absence of life force.
